texts.es: Santos de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 17, 14, 12 y 10 años de edad todos estudian actualmente, es una mujer  trabajadora, honesta y responsable con su hogar y con su trabajo, desde hace 3 años se dedica al cultivos de  maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de su ganancias logra cubrir los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, doña santos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, herramientas, etc. para seguir con su siembra y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santos is 35 years old. She lives  in her own house with her husband and four children, aged 17, 14, 12 and 10. All of them are in school now. She is a hardworking, honest and responsible woman in her home and at work. She has grown corn and beans for 3 years. She sells her products in different markets close to her home. With what she obtains from her earnings she is able to cover household expenses. Santos is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, tools, etc. to continue with her farming and thus obtain better earnings and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de pilones de café desde hace varios años, comercializa los pilones en los alrededores de la zona, tiene mucha clientela ya establecida por la calidad de sus cultivos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Saúl está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. Para poder seguir con sus cultivos que le generan buenas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Saúl is 44 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and three children. He has worked growing coffee seedlings for several years. He sells the seedlings around the area where he lives. He has a lot of regular customers because of the quality of his crops and the good prices. With what he earns from his work he is able to cover some of his household expenses. Saúl is asking for a loan to be able to buy fertilizer, pest control, etc. in order to continue with his crops, which generate good earnings and give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es: Nelva, de 38 años, está casada con Luis. Ambos tienen una hija a la que quieren y educan en su casa propia.Nelva una mujer carismática y de iniciativas; hace casi 2 años comenzó con el negocio de la venta de petróleo y gasolina, en la calle principal de su localidad, donde alquiló un pequeño espacio. Según cuenta vende un promedio de S/. 480 nuevos soles como máximo, ya que no existen muchos grifos en la zona. Además de aprovechar sus tiempos libres en tejer pequeñas gorras de lana, que comercializa a los intermediarios que la visitan constantemente. Pero su principal objetivo es consolidar su actividad de negocios. “A la semana me llega como 3 cilindros de gasolina y otros 2 de petróleo y si los vendo en esos 7 días, si me va bien”, menciona.El negocio no para, ya que el tránsito de vehículos no se detiene, por esa razón requiere de su ayuda para adquirir más mercadería y continuar con éxito en el negocio. Este su tercer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Nelva, invertirá el dinero en la compra de más gasolina y si el dinero le alcanza comprará también madejas de lana para continuar tejiendo.
texts.en: Nelva is 38 years old and she is married to Luis. They have a daughter whom the love and raise in the house they own. Nelva is a charismatic woman with initiative. Two years ago, she started a business selling oil and gas on the main street in her town, where she rented a small space. According to her, she sells an average of S/. 480 nuevos soles at a maximum, since there aren't a lot of taps in the area. In her free time. she also knits small wool hats which she sells to intermediaries who constantly visit her. But her main objective is consolidating her business activity.  “Per week I get about 3 cylinders of gasoline and another 2 of oil and if I sell those in 7 days, it has gone well for me.", she says. The business doesn't stop, since vehicle traffic doesn't stop. That is why she needs your help to acquire more merchandise and continue to be successful in the business. This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial help she is receiving to continue ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time. Nelva will invest the money in buying more gasoline and if there is enough money she will buy skeins of wool to keep knitting.

loans.use: to buy fuel.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposa quien vende verduras y frutas en el mercado, desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura  especialmente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona y tiene mucha clientela que lo busca por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, adicional a eso trabaja como jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y sus trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposa logran solventar algunos gatos de su hogar, Pedro esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder seguir con sus cosechas y poderle dar a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitaciones alguna.
texts.en:
Pedro is 60 years old. He lives with his three children and his wife in their own house. His wife sells vegetables and fruits on the market. Pedro has worked in agriculture for 15 years, especially in the cultivation of corn and beans. He sells his goods in the area surrounding where he lives and he has many customers who buy from him because of the quality of his goods and the good prices.

In addition to this, he works as a day laborer at a farm nearby. With the earnings he gets from his sales and from his work and with the help of his wife, they are able to pay off some household expenses. 

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pesticides, herbicides, etc. This is so that he can continue with his crops and give his family all they need without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla habita en casa de su madre junto a su hijo de 16 años, quien cursa la secundaria. Trabaja como cocinera en un hospital público de Managua. Solicita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como bloques, cemento,  arena, hierro, para hacer una pequeña mejora en la parte trasera de la cocina, la cual requiere de hacer unos cambios ya que esta está muy deteriorada y no presta las condiciones necesarias para habitar. Con esta obra tendrá un poco más de espacio y sobre todo condiciones e higiene, para el bien común de la familia.
texts.en: Karla lives in her mother's house with her 16 year old son who is in high school. She works as a cook in a public hospital in Managua. She is asking for this loan to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand, and iron rods to to a small improvement on the back part of the kitchen. It requires her to make some changes, since it has really deteriorated and is not in condition to be used. With the work, she will have a little more space and better conditions and hygiene, for the common good of the family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, and iron rods.

loans.name: Loveline

texts.en: Loveline is married with four children. Her family lives in a three-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, in the Northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are the death of family members like her father, an early marriage, and inadequate capital to manage her business. She has taken and successfully repaid three loans and says with this new loan she has requested she will expand her pig farm by buying more piglets and open a poultry farm where she will rear chicks. She has a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time, she has experience in business, she has a good business site, there is high demand for poultry and she has enough time to manage her business. With this business activity, the community will buy her products at cheaper prices, and she will also sell manure to her customers. With the profit from this loan, she will pay her children's school fees, cater for the feeding of her family, provide medication to her family and pay her bills. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To pay for piglets and chicks with their feed

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine is married with five children and they all live in a three bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. 

She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are the deaths of family members like her mother, sister, and father, an accident that left her child seriously injured, and inadequate capital to manage her business.

She has taken and successfully repaid a loan twice and says with this new loan requested, she will expand her pig farm by buying more piglets, expand her provision store in her compound, buy firewood for resale, and also engage in the sale of cooked food. She has a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time, she has experience in the businesses, she has a good business site, and she has a good approach that encourages her customers to buy on a regular basis. With this business activity, the community will buy her products and she will also sell at cheaper prices to her customers.

With the profit from this loan, she will pay her children's school fees, cater to the feeding of her family, provide medication to her family, pay her bills and also engage in farm work. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy chicks, firewood, farm seedlings, piglets and provisions

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 44-year-old married woman living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been doing this business for many years and earns a reasonable income for his family. He is a milkman by profession; he sales milk near his community. He purchases milk from a wholesaler and sells it as a retailer via his shop. He wants to offer yogurt according to demand but he does not have enough money to buy more milk for the production of yogurt.

Therefore, Balqees has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to purchase fresh milk to sell.

Balqees hopes that she will be able to save money through the profits earned.

Balqees would like to thank the Kiva lenders and Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy milk for the production of yogurt to sell.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen is married with seven children. He is 51 years old and lives in the Baray district in the Kampong Thom province. He is a farmer and grows rice and seasonal crops to earn a living. He has been in this occupation for years. He has the support of his wife and children, who are living together with him. Aside from the income generated from farming activities, other sources of income are from two of his children, who are employed at a garment factory, and another one is a clothes vendor in a local market of the province.

Sen has requested a loan of $1,000 for the purchase of used clothes to sustain his daughter’s selling business. He hopes that through the loan, the business will make good progress and provide a better income. He thanks the lenders for their constant support. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sustain his daughter’s selling business.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
BADENYA est un groupe de l’association SIGUIKADI de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de  condiments et de céréales à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la première personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
KADIATOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU et excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, quelques sacs de riz et de maïs Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et village environnant et vend ses marchandises à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Badenya is a sub-group of Siguikadi of Ouelessebougou. It is made up of 4 women who came to know each other as relatives and neighbors. Their average age is 25 years, they are married, and have an average of 4 children each. The women each conduct small businesses such as the sale of spices and cereals. One such of these women is Kadiatou, who is the first person pictured standing from right to left.

The women of the group live in traditional large families in Ouelessebougou in the district of Kati (in the Koulikoro region of Mali.) They have all been in business for several years and are in high demand in their respective trades. In order to meet the growing needs of their customers, the members of the group decided to make use of the loan program from Soro Yiriwaso.

Kadiatou is the president of the group and very well known in Oulessebougou. She is a very successful cereal seller. She plans to use her loan to purchase bags of rice and corn. She stocks up in Oulessebougo and the neighboring villages, and sells her merchandise in Oulessebougou at retail for both cash and credit, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
Marguerite is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child, who is attending school. Her husband has worked at a local library for the past six years, and he represents the main source of income. 

As for her, and in order to help her companion to supplement the family’s income, she opened a beauty salon five years ago and she is very talented at her job. 

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase cosmetics and beauty products at good prices. She is well known in her region and neighboring towns by her good reputation, and she is certain that the new products will help her to better serve her clients and therefore increase her income. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her salon and start offering new services such as hair removal.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and beauty products at good prices

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old, and married to Winfred; they have three children who are in school.

He has a cyber cafe business in Naivasha which he has been running for one year; he has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to purchase computers. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to own the biggest cyber cafe in Gilgil.

loans.use: To buy computers.

loans.name: Heman

texts.en: Heman is 41 years old and has a family including two school-aged children. He was previously working as a field worker for a banana company. In 2008, he started, with the support of Seva MFI, to cultivate rice and has repaid all his loans on time. Meanwhile, he does his rice cultivation on 12 acres of land and now has a tractor. He wants to renovate his house and save for his daughter who is going this school year at Paramaribo to study. He is asking for a new loan of SRD 12,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Jodhan

texts.en: Jodhan is 41 years old and has a family including three children and one daughter-in-law. Two of his children are still going to school.  Previously, he was breeding cattle and sheep and worked for other rice farmers in the fields. In 2008, he started, with the support of Seva MFI, his own rice cultivation. He plants rice on a plot of land that he inherited from his parents. With his savings, he bought a second hand tractor. Jodhan wants his two children to have a higher education and he even wants to buy a piece of land for his livestock. He approached Seva MFI for a new loan of SRD 10.000 to improve his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rajindra

texts.en: Rajindra is 50 years old and has a family that includes three children. Besides cultivating rice, he raises cows and sheep for resale. He started in 2008 with the support of Seva MFI to cultivate rice on 7 hectares of land. Because he lacks investment capital, he used to lease his land out to third parties. Meanwhile, with the support of Seva MFI, he was able to expand his cultivated land to 12 hectares. With the profits from the last years, he bought a second-hand tractor, built his house and married off one of his children. He is asking for a new loan of SRD 10.000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Bechan

texts.en: Bechan is a young entrepreneur who is planting rice on eight hectares of land that he inherited from his parents. He has received loans from Seva MFI since 2009. He is a serious farmer and has been able to repay his loans on time. With the profits from the past years, he bought a second-hand tractor. He needs a loan of SRD 6,500 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. His dream is to have a family and his own house. For this, he will plant on a larger piece of land so he can increase his income and save more money.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Rakesh

texts.en: After the death of his father, Rakesh is now the breadwinner at home. He lives with his mother and two sisters. Besides cultivating rice, he works in his free time as a school bus driver. In 2009, he started cultivating rice cultivation on two hectares of land with a loan of SRD 2,000 from Seva MFI. This has now been extended to 11 hectares. With the profits, he built a residential house for his family. He wants to start his own family but still has a sister who must marry. Rakesh works hard to save for this. He needs a new loan of SRD 11,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Gen

texts.en: Gen, 29 years old, lost his parents at a young age. As a school dropout, he started planting rice on the land of this family. With the help of relatives, he purchased a mini-excavator, which he rents out to his fellow rice farmers during the off season. This gives him extra income. In 2012, Gen got a loan from Seva MFI for the first time, which he fully repaid on schedule. He would like to increase his production from three hectares to six hectares with a new loan from Seva MFI. For this, he needs a loan of SRD 7,500.

loans.use: To buy rice plots

loans.name: Mitre

texts.en: Mitre is 49 years old and has a family that includes two school-aged children. He does not own any rice acreage so he plants on 16 hectares of rented land. Rice cultivation is the only source of income for the family. Mitre owns a second hand tractor for cultivation. His wife and children are actively involved with the rice cultivation. In 2010, Mr. Mitre first became eligible for a loan from Seva MFI. He has been able to repay on time the loans he received. With the profits from recent seasons, he has expanded his house and did major maintenance on his tractor. The goals of the family are to make sure the children finish school and to save enough for their future. Mr. and Mrs. Mitre are asking for a loan of SRD 12,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating rice

loans.name: Dew

texts.en: Dew is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. He is a carpenter by profession, but he also does rice cultivation on land that he inherited from his father. In 2009, he bought a second hand tractor with a loan from Seva MFI. He uses the tractor for additional income during off seasons and in periods when he doesn’t need the tractor on his own land. His dream is to give both of his children a proper education and a good future. He is asking for a new loan of SRD 11.000 to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Safraas

texts.en: Safraas is 29 years old. He is married and has two young children. In 2010, he started to plant rice with the support of Seva MFI. In his free time, he is involved in the fishery business, which gives him much needed extra income. Safraas lives in a rented house. His dream is to have his own house and take good care of his family. With the profits from prior years, he has expanded his rice areas. He needs a new loan of SRD 10.000 for his rice production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 50 years old and married to Paul, with three children who are in school.

She is in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, which she has practiced for 20 years.  She has applied for a seventh loan from Kadet Ltd, after paying her previous loans on time. 

She wants to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand her farming business and also buy dairy cows.

She hopes to apply for bigger loans from Kadet Ltd to expand her farming business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham was born in 1976. She lives with her husband at a sector in Jordan called Karak. Her husband is in the military. 

Elham has been selling foodstuffs at her mini-market for two years. She started her project selling simple products. Then she expanded it slowly. Elham is planning to expand her project more in the future. 

Now she wants to stock her mini-market with foodstuffs and detergents with the aim of raising her profit and sales, and to support her husband in improving their living conditions. But she doesn't have enough money to do so, so she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To stock her mini-market with foodstuffs and detergents

loans.name: Acela

texts.en:
Acela is married with seven children; she resides in Cabgan, Tambulig in Zamboanga del Sur, along with her family. Her husband is a fisherman, and she helps him manage their own fishpond to make a living. 

In 2008, she joined GDMPC and recently, she borrowed 20,000 PHP to purchase feed and fingerlings (small fish). She always finds a way to augment their living.

In the future, she want to own a fishing boat to use for the business and able to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and fingerlings (small fish)

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 50 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is single and has two children aged 2 and 5.  They all live with her mother and all of them are attending school.

For the past two years Anna has been selling oil, cube, rice coal, soap, etc in the local market. Sometimes her customers use credit and then refuse to pay. She started this business with 1000 Liberian dollars which was given to her by her mother. She is now requesting a loan to purchase oil, cubes, rice, coal, soap, etc. for her business. 

She hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase oil, cubes, rice, coal, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is already 47 years old. She is married, and the mother of three school-aged children. Her husband, whose name is Marcelo, works as a farmer. Living together as one family in their village of Mabini is a treasure for Milagros. 

She manages a general store business to supplement her husband's income from farming. In six years in doing the business, she has observed an average income of PHP 7,000 each month. 

Her dream to further grow the business for bigger sales has pushed her to borrow a loan that will be used to buy a stock of merchandise like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and many other things.

loans.use: to buy a stock of merchandise like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and many other things.

loans.name: Dolorquita

texts.en:
Dolorquita is 55 years old, married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Dolorquita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Dolorquita has been in this business for two years, and in the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 40 years old and lives in Lundazi with his wife and three children.  He operates a small mobile money business.  In order to continue to grow his business, Jimmy is requesting a second Kiva loan.  

Jimmy has successfully paid back his first Kiva loan, which enabled him to increase his working capital to serve more customers.  Now, Jimmy is adding new services like mobile airtime sales to his shop and needs additional working capital in order to do so.  Jimmy is thankful for the opportunity to access a loan through Kiva because securing working capital still remains a major challenge in growing his business.  

As Jimmy adds new services to his mobile money business he anticipates he will gain new customers.  This will help him earn more profit.  With his increased earnings Jimmy hopes to provide a good education and better life for his children.

loans.use: To add to his working capital, which will allow him to serve more customers sending and receiving money at his shop.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Before he owned CJ’s Grocery, Pedro was a regular employee. But when the opportunity to purchase the business arose, this native of Mexico reached into his savings to purchase and enhance the convenience store.

Five years have passed since Pedro purchased the shop and began supplying his neighborhood with groceries, and to keep up with the demand and expansion of his business, Pedro ventured to his bank, which turned him to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan. 

Once approved, Pedro, the store’s only employee, used his Accion loan to purchase inventory and make minor repairs. Now, the 54-year-old father of six says his next goal is to create a job in the community.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and make minor repairs.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali came to the US over 20 years ago from Palestine, where he owned his own printing company. In the states, he began working in the restaurant industry through family and friends. Ali decided to branch out on his own and open King’s Restaurant, serving authentic halal fare in Newark, NJ.

King’s Restaurant is a family business, and Ali’s son and daughter are heavily involved in the business. The customer service and excellent quality food set Ali’s restaurant apart from other restaurants.

The funds from this loan will go toward purchasing a slow burner to offer rotisserie chicken at the restaurant. Ali also plans on expanding and opening another restaurant in a different location. Eventually, he would like to open other businesses, including a cyber café. Ali’s ultimate goal is to be able to employ others and provide jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a slow burner rotisserie for his halal restaurant.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, two of whom are still attending school. 

She has worked as a private teacher since 2010; her business is based in her home. At the same time, and in order to earn more income, she works as an accountant at a local aluminum factory. 

Today, Amale states that she needs a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to renovate the teaching room in her house and equip it with needed supplies. The school year is about to start, and Amale is trying to do her best to get ready to welcome her students at a comfortable residence to be well educated.

loans.use: to renovate the teaching room at her house and equip it with needed supplies

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is 32 years old and married with one kid, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Joanne has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Joanne requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell.

Joanne has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Joanne would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Aguita

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Aguita to improve her business; she opened her kiosk in 2002 on her own. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, like toys. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business, after years of doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy stock, like toys, to sell.

loans.name: Sweileh

texts.en:
Sweileh was born in 1975. She is a widowed woman who is a mother of seven. 

Sweileh is trying her best to support herself and her children after her husband's death. She and her brother work in a mini market that they have owned for one year. She started this project by selling food with her brother from their home. Then they started working independently. 

Now she is planning to raise the quantity of food and other products at her mini market in order to raise their sales and profit to be able to support her children. Unfortunately, however, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more food and other products for her mini market.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in Likoni area south of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 29 years old and single. 

She sells charcoal in the nearby market and she has been in the business for two months. She knew Milango through friends and she decided to join so that she could save and be able to access funds for the business. 

She now seeks a loan to buy sacks of charcoal for sale. She hopes that in the next five years the business will become wholesale. The challenge that she faces is that some suppliers cheat by selling her bad charcoal. The extra income that she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Bemilda Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Bemilda ha venido trabajando desde hace muchos años en un cafetín y comedor, donde hace desayunos y almuerzos para vender, está ubicado en un mercado de Managua, ahí mismo vende un poco de cosméticos y reposterías. Con los ingresos obtenidos ayuda a su familia con los gastos del hogar, vive con una de sus hijas, la que también le ayuda en el negocio. doña Bemilda es separada y busca la manera de salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para invertir en productos de granos básicos, frutas variadas para refrescos, gaseosas, carne, pollo, perfumes y reposterías.
texts.en:
Bemilda has been working for many years in a cafeteria and diner, where she prepares breakfasts and lunches to sell. It is located in a market in Managua.There, she also sells some cosmetics and baked goods. 

With her income she helps her family with household expenses. She lives with one of her daughters, who also helps in the business. Bemilda is separated and is looking for a way to prosper. 

She is requesting a loan to buy products such as basic grains, varied fruits for soft drinks, sodas, meat, chicken, perfumes and baked goods.

loans.use: to buy products such as basic grains, varied fruits for soft drinks, sodas, meat, chicken, perfumes and baked goods.

loans.name: El Rincon De Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Rincon de las Amigas está en su ciclo número 19 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, trabajando de igual manera por ir mejorando.
Laura  es una de las integrantes, y cuenta que se dedica a  la venta de insumos de primera necesidad, ella es una persona muy luchadora, quien siempre se ha esforzado para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia por medio de su esfuerzo. Ella quiere tener un negocio fijo el día de mañana y es por eso que está luchando día a día.
La Sra. Laura solicita de este crédito para la compra de yerbas, panificados, lácteos, dulces, conservantes, galletitas, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group El Rincón de las Amigas is at its 19th cycle of the Women's Committee Program, where all its members work and help each other to get ahead. They have done the test for the elimination of poverty and two members are currently below the poverty line and keep working to improve their situation. Laura is one of the group's members and works selling first-necessity products. She is a hard-working woman who has always made every effort to grow and help her family. She wants to have a business in the future and fights every day to reach that dream. 

Laura is requesting a loan to buy herbs, bread products, dairy products, candy, preserving products, cookies, etc. This loan will help her to materialize her business plan, to improve her income and to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy herbs, bread products, dairy products, candy, preserving products, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Eufemio Nicolas

texts.es: Don Eufemio padre responsable que ha venido apoyando sus tres hijos en su educación, su esposa es ama de casa, y él labora como albañil, uno de sus hijos administra un pequeño cyber café en donde también vende gas, ubicado en su casa de habitación. Con estos ingresos se ayuda don Eufemio para poder con todos los gastos de la familia y del hogar. El solicita este crédito para cambiar las paredes divisorias de plycem de su cuarto y hacerlas de concreto para brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia. Comprará materiales como cemento, bloques, arena, hierro.
texts.en:
Don Eufemio is a responsible father who has supported his children throughout their education. His wife is a housewife. He works as a mason and one of his children runs a cyber café at home, where he also sells gas. This income helps don Eufemio to cover the home expenses.

He is requesting a loan to change some walls that are made of plasterboard and build new ones in concrete to offer his family a more comfortable living. He will buy materials such as cement, bricks, sand and iron.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, bricks, sand and iron.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 33-year-old married man living with his wife and two children who are attending school. He is the one and only income provider for the family. He has been involved in the construction field for the past five years. He owns a mini tractor which he uses to complete his tasks in a very professional way. 

Today, he is in need to receive a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to equip his tractor with new wheels. He only aims to carry on with his operations in a proper way and end up with good results to satisfy his customers' demands and earn sufficient income.

loans.use: to equip his tractor with new wheels.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 27 years old and has a phone accessories shop in Tala town. She has been in this business for five years, and it has been profitable. She also runs a mobile money transfer business in the same shop. She is widowed and has two children.

This being her second loan term, she plans to use the loan to buy more stock of phone accessories to sell in her shop. These include phone covers, batteries, and phone chargers, among other accessories. She also plans to add some money float to her mobile money transfer business.

She will use the generated profits to educate her children. Joyce hopes to educate her children, give them a good life, and be a successful business lady in the future.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 44 years old, married and a resident of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.   She opened a sari-sari (general store), with 3,000 PHP capital, and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. 

She is now applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities like canned goods, soft drinks and other items to sell.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories of canned goods, soft drinks and other sellable items

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is age 50. She is the mother of seven children.

Her son owns a clothing business. He buys fabrics from wholesalers and sells as a retailer in his shop. Now the demand for clothing has been increased due to upcoming Eid. He has lot of customers who like to buy fabrics from him. He has good reputation in his town and his business is going on well. Due to the increasing demand, he wants to get benefit through this opportunity.

Therefore, Zareena requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand and could get benefit.

Zareena dreams for the bright future of her children, establishment of the business and for a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for her son to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
This is Joan, 25, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Melvin, a painter, and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joan operates the buy and sell business of her family. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy because of the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She also has a direct selling business and an electronic loading station for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 60,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy ready-to-wear clothing for her business. She will also use the loan to buy supplies and merchandise products for her direct selling business.

Joan dreams to expand her business and hopes to give a good life to her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Maradi

texts.en:
Maradi was born in 1990. She lives in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband, who works at a gas station. 

Maradi has been selling blankets for one year. She started her project by selling a small quantity of them. Then she started increasing her merchandise and sales as she found her project profitable. 

Now she is planning to add clothes to her project to raise her profit and income in order to help her husband in improving their living conditions. She doesn't have enough money to buy them, however. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes and more blankets to trade.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 55 years old and married to Joyce, who is a farmer.  They are supporting one child who is in school.

He is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has practiced for 13 years. He has applied for a seventh loan from Kadet Ltd., after paying his previous loans on time, to enable him to pay school fees.

He hopes to be a leading exporter of horticultural products in the near future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 45 years old and a married woman. She has four children; one of them goes to school and the remaining sons do jobs in a firm. 

She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

She says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran is 56 years old, widowed, and has one child. She lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and raising animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $4 a day. Her child is an English teacher who earns $5 a day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Ran is requesting a loan for $900, which she will use to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses and her child will be able to use it for commuting to work. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 36-year-old single mother of five children who are in school.

She is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru which she has practiced for eighteen years.  Alice has applied for her third loan from Kadet Ltd. after paying her previous loans on time.  She will use this loan to enable her to transport her vegetables to the market for sale. With anticipated profits, she plans to buy a car which she will then be able to use to transport her farming produce to the market.

In the near future she hopes to apply for bigger loans from KADET Ltd. to enable her to expand her farming business.

loans.use: To pay for transportation of her vegetables to the market.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch is 28 years old and a married woman of two dependent children. She operates a farming business in a small village of Siem province, which is well-known for its ancient temples, especially Angkor Wat. Every day, she goes in the field, where she spends most of her time of the day, especially during the rainy season from May to October. Though she has to work hard in her rice paddy, it doesn’t matter to her because the important thing is to provide enough for the sake of her family members.

As of now, she has applied for a loan amount of $1,500 U.S. dollars to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and insecticides, which will be used toward the growth of her rice field. Also with a portion of the loan, she will buy construction supplies for her husband, who works in the construction field. She hopes that by this season, she can get better crop production to save for her children’s needs and education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and insecticides, which will be used toward the growth of her rice field.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
TIESSIRI est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et de la restaurant à l’image de NIAGALE qui est la première personne  debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
NIAGALE, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue et appréciée à TIELE pour la qualité de ses plats délicieux. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires (oignon, choux), de la viande et du riz pour des fins de restauration.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Tiessiri is a group of 4 women of the Benkadi association in Tiele.  The women are all members of the same family or neighbours.  They have an average age of 40 years and are all married with an average of 3 children.  The group members run different businesses such as the buying and selling of vegetables and catering.  Niagale runs a catering business and is standing on the far right of the photo.  The women live in large, traditional families in Tiele, in the prefecture of Kati (in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali).  They have run their small businesses for several years and there is a strong demand for their products.  In order to satisfy the growing demands of their customers, the group members decided to use the loan programme of Soro Yiriwaso three years ago.  This will be their sixth group loan.

Niagale is the president of the group and is well-known and much appreciated in Tiele, for the delicious, high-quality food that she prepares.   She intends to use this loan to buy ingredients (onions, cabbage), meat and rice for her catering business.  She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally, from wholesalers, and sells her meals in Tiele through retail, cash and credit sales to both men and women.  She hopes to use her predicted, monthly earnings of 25,000 francs CFA to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a catering business.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
As Christian graduated from UTSA, the University of Texas at San Antonio, she didn’t hesitate to take her accounting degree to the bank, which then informed her of nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc. 

Once she applied and was approved for a loan, McAllen-born Christian opened High Style in one of the four major malls in San Antonio. Since the grand opening of the shop in June, 2013, the 26-year-old has already hired four employees and is expecting to hire a manager.

The Accion loan helped Christian purchase inventory and pay her employees. Selling bags and accessories, but mostly shoes, Christian needed to purchase more of what she already sold out on. 

Check out what Christian has to offer here: http://highstylestore.com/.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and pay her employees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda was born in 1967. She is married and a mother of seven. Her husband works at a governmental entity. Majeda has been selling clothes since seven years ago. She started her project selling a small quantity of them at home to her neighbors and friends. Then she started receiving more customers. 

Majeda is planning to open her own independent clothes store for the aim of raising her sales. Now she needs a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes in order to raise her profit and income to cover her children's needs and to improve their living conditions, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of clothes to trade.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a 37-year-old lady who is trading secondhand clothes in open markets. She is married and has six children. She works six days in a week and gives the business an average of 10 hours per day. She started the business in 2009 with a mind of getting a stable source of income, and has seen the business grow from one level to another by the day. 

Sylivia would like to use the loan money amounting to 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings to buy two bales of clothes, which she hopes to sell at a profit. Her clients are both male and female since she sells clothes meant for both men and women. Lack of enough capital and stiff competition are her major challenges, but she hopes to overcome these with the UGAFODE Microfinance loan, if given, and believes that she will be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy two bales of clothes.

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Chanthol is 34 years old. She is married and lives with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband purchases cattle to resell and earns about $8 per day. 

To improve her family’s finances, Chanthol is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase cattle to resell. This money will help her husband obtain enough funds to expand his business and generate more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to add more capital to expand the business and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she wants to build a fence around her house to improve her family’s security.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 8, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer en qué situación esta cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nancy quien en su última encuesta mostró que ella estaba mejorando bastante, pero es consciente de que debe seguir esforzándose. Ella comenta que realiza venta de hortalizas, tiene su propia producción, también se debe destacar el gran esfuerzo que ella esta poniendo para poder seguir creciendo y saliendo adelante.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de semillas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" group is on its eighth loan cycle and all the members are undergoing the poverty elimination survey in order to establish each one's individual situation.

One member of the group is Nancy. The last time she underwent the survey she was seen to be improving greatly but she is aware of the fact that she must keep working hard.  Nancy tells us that she grows and sells vegetables.  It must be mentioned that Nancy is putting in a great deal of effort in order to continue growing and getting ahead.

Nancy is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds.  this will help her to realise her business plan, helping her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 50 años es  casada  con 03 hijos independientes actualmente es socia del grupo “Las Esmeraldas” conformada por 07 mujeres trabajadores y unidas. Con los deseos de mejorar sus ingresos  y salir adelante Yolanda toma la decisión de emprender su propio negocio de la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su negocio ha mejorado su vivienda. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará  para la compra de verduras, abarrotes y bebidas. El anhelo de Yolanda es de mejorar su tienda. El grupo “Las Esmeraldas” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por colaborar con su progreso. Yolanda es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo rosado y chaleco negro.
texts.en: Yolanda is 50 years old.  She is married and has three children, now independent adults.  Yolanda is a member of the "Las Esmeraldas" group, which is made up of seven hard-working and united women.  With a desire to improve her income and get ahead, Yolanda took the decision to start her own business selling basic, staple goods.  Yolanda is proud as, thanks to her business, she has made improvements to her home.  Yolanda is applying for a loan in order to buy vegetables, groceries and drinks.  Yolanda's wish is to improve her shop.  The "Las Esmeraldas" group thanks Kiva investors for supporting them and helping them to progress. In the photo Yolanda is the second on the left - she is wearing a pink t-shirt with a black vest.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, sweets, and drinks.

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en:
Fenny is 37 years old and married to Saka. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling cereals for the last nine years with a monthly income of 14,800 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She managed to get a first loan with KADET LTD. of 10,000 KES, with which she plans to purchase more stock. The anticipated profit she will use to improve her living standards. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock of cereals.

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en:
Hawah is doing well in her business of selling clothes. She used her first loan well, and her average income increased from 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to 35,000 KES. With that income, she was able to repay the loan on time and expand her business as well as meet her family's financial needs.

She has borrowed a second loan of 100,000 KES of which she will use the whole amount to purchase more clothing for sale during the September to December season, which are good seasons with high income in her business since most farmers in her locality get tea bonuses; thus, they spend.

She anticipates getting profits, which she will use to pay back the loan as well as expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 23 years old and single. He is from Lebanon. In 2012, he decided to launch his own business as a furniture painter. He has one part-time employee.  

Ali is requesting a youth loan from Vitas s.a.l., which he will use to purchase electrical machinery for his business operations. In the future, Ali seeks to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase electrical machinery

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely is 45 years old and has four children. She operates a sari-sari store (general store).

Arcely is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of groceries such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, and soft drinks to sell. The loan will help Arcely improve her sales as the income generated from her store is not enough to cover their daily expenses, such as school fees and food.  She hopes to increase her opportunity to earn additional income and upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, and soft drinks

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlina tiene 24 años y la vivienda donde habita se encuentra en la cálida ciudad de Aguaytia, es una joven de condición humilde y es por ello que cada dia lucha con muchas ganas para poder salir salir adelante y apoyar a su familia, es por ello que luego de mucho esfuerzo ha logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, Herlinda le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, Herlinda cree que le va viene n su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece productos de buena calidad.

Herlina esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar un vitrina con la cual podrá exhibir mejor sus productos, así mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 24 years old and she lives in the warm city of Aguaytia.  Herlinda is a humble young woman and every day she enthusiastically fights to get ahead and to support her family.  With a lot of effort Herlinda has managed to start a business selling groceries. Herlinda works around ten hours per day and serves up to fifteen customers each day.  Herlinda thinks that her business is going well because she is friendly with customers and offers good quality products.

Herlinda is grateful to Kiva lenders as, thank to the support provided, she will be able to buy a display case for her products.  Herlinda's profits will increase and she will continue fighting to make her dream of having a mini-supermarket become a reality.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 35 years old, married, and supports a family of 4 dependents. She has been running a chemist shop for the last two years, earning a monthly income of about KES 18,000. With a 2nd loan of KES 40,000 she plans to purchase medicines to sell. The anticipated profits will be plowed back for business expansion. Her dream is to be successful in business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines to sell.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Joseph, who is in his late thirties, is married with three sons and a daughter. Joseph's children are in school. 

For a year now, Joseph has been managing his family expenses by running different businesses. One of the businesses is selling fruits and vegetables.  His second business is selling charcoal. His last business is providing transportation with his motorbike. Joseph does these activities with his wife and they are doing great with all businesses. Joseph starts work at 07:00 am and works until 09:00 pm each working day. He makes a very good monthly profit. 

This is Joseph's first loan request to Tujijenge Tanzania. Joseph will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. He dreams that one day he will be able to expand all his businesses so as to give him better returns.
 
Joseph will share this loan with his loan group "Ulezi" which totals three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children. He is the owner of a small shop where he sells fish and meat. He recently got involved in this type of business. He showed high competence during this period and was able to build a wide clientele because of his friendly personality. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase meat. Samir is planning to expand his business and augment his sales as he aims to gain higher income to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old married Palestinian refugee, who has worked since 2010 at providing the camp's citizens with internet services to home and businesses. He is a hard worker who puts in much effort to please and satisfy his current and future customers, because he believes that they are his main source for making a living.

Mohamad is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to develop his internet service inside the camp. He will add to the network machines he needs that will increase internet speed and the quality served. The main obstacle in his domain is that he is limited inside the camp, which he aims to skip in the future through developing wide internet services providing companies with techniques that can cover the nearby villages.

loans.use: to develop his internet service inside the camp.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 57. She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and has three children. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Yolanda operates a food stall. She sells snacks like banana cue, hotdogs, barbecue and other snacks. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Yolanda earns a minimum of PHP 700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ingredients and products like hotdogs, pork, bananas and other ingredients needed in her food stall. Yolanda hopes that her business will flourish and dreams to have an abundant life. Yolanda meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients and products like hotdogs, pork, bananas and other ingredients needed in her food stall.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita is 63 years old. She is married and has four children. Ramonita works very hard to provide for them.

Ramonita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. Ramonita has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Ramonita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 28 years old, married, and has a child. He is a farmer who grows rice to sell. He also provides motorcycle transport service for an additional income aside from farming. For his farm, he hires additional laborers who help him plant and harvest the rice. 

His income from the previous harvest helped him move on to the next planting season, but it was insufficient. That is why he is now borrowing a loan to buy fertilizers and pay for the labor costs of farming. This way, he will be able to improve his crops for a better yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the labor costs of farming.

loans.name: Kijitonyama Group

texts.en:
Hilda, who is in her late 20s, is married with one daughter who is still small.  She has been running a beauty salon business for six years now.  She works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Hilda's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying a dryer and more salon equipment. She dreams of expanding her business by opening another salon.

Hilda will share this loan with her loan group of five members, called "Kijitonyama", who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and more salon equipment.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is married and has seven school age children and resides at Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, she manages the family's own fishpond. Her previous loan that was used in her fishing business has been successfully repaid. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials like fishing nets. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like fishing nets.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old, married to Isaiah and has two children who are in school.

She is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru which she has practiced for thirteen years.  Lucy has now applied for her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. after repaying her previous loans on time.  She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. With anticipated profits, Lucy plans to expand her farming business and also pay school fees.

She hopes to expand her farming business and improve her family living standards in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents in Alcala. She is a helpful child. Jocelyn helps her parents in their farming business because she no longer can continue her studying due to financial difficulties. The income generated from farming went towards her family's daily meals, paying bills at home and was used as revolving capital in the business. 

She hoped to keep improving their crop production for a profitable harvest but had insufficient funds. Because of this, she is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay the labor costs of farming. She hopes to keep improving their crop production, to help her parents improve their living conditions, and to progress the best they can.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay the labor costs of farming.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Melanie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products and e-loading (prepaid mobile load). 

Melanie is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to buy an engine for her fishing boat for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam, 38 years old, is a single mother of five children, living in a peaceful village in the Rolea B’lier district, in Kampong Chhnang province. She owns and manages a rice farming business to earn a living and to support her children with their basic necessities. She has been a farmer for almost 14 years and usually earns a net profit of $5.00 per day. The house she lives in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some renovation. She has saved some money to start this construction and plans to increase her yields and income to add to her savings. 

However, due to inadequate capital, she has requested a loan of 1,300 US dollars to buy wood and planks of wood for her home improvement. By doing so, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the coming rainy season. Soam thanks the Kiva lenders for their constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy wood and planks of wood for home improvement.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Alcala together with her family. To make a living, she buys and sells vegetables in the public market while her spouse manages their farming business. From their simple living, she was able to send her children to college. Elizabeth also helps her husband in the field, planting and harvesting. Income generated from the business was invested for their immediate necessities, the education of their children and to pay some bills at home. Elizabeth manages their income well to the point of economizing their expenses. 

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP10,000 to use in farming because they had insufficient funds to sustain their crops this season. She will buy supplies like fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Jilda

texts.en: Jilda is a 29-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, child, and parents-in-law. Her father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Jilda works at a local kindergarten and earns 150 GEL per month. Her husband is unemployed now. As the income is not enough to cover their everyday costs, Jilda requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,000 GEL to purchase calves. She will raise them and start producing dairy products to sell. The Start Up program will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Marcel

texts.fr: marcel est une homme de 29 ans . Il a ouvert un pressing qu'elle gère depuis 3 ans. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Il aimerai s'acheter une nouvelle machine à laver pour augmenter la rapidité et satisfaction de sa clientèle. d'où la nécessité ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra de d'augmenter, satisfaire, fidéliser sa clientèle . Il réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marcel is a 29-year-old man. He opened a laundromat which he has operated for the last 3 years. It is because of this business that he is able to provide for his family.

Marcel would like to purchase a new washing machine to increase the speed of his service and better satisfy his customers. It is for this reason that he is requesting this loan, which will allow him to increase, satisfy, and gain loyalty from his customers. He will reinvest a portion of his earnings in his business and the rest will help him provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new washing machine

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa  está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con el cual podrán saber la situación en la que cada una se encuentra, y de esa forma poder crecer y ayudar a sus familias y que no tengan que pasar por privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Cinthia, quien tiene una peluquería modesta en la que trabaja todos los días, y es mediante su negocio que ayuda a su familia, y lucha para poder darles lo que necesitan. Ella con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar su negocio y poco a poco con su esfuerzo está creciendo.
Hoy pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y demás, y así seguir dando a sus clientas un buen servicio, y también seguir luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Kuna Guapa is making a study of how to eliminate poverty. With the results, they will understand the situation confronting each member. In this manner, group members will be able to grow and assist their families and no longer have to suffer the privations of the past.
 	
One member worthy of being singled out is Cinthia who has a modest beauty salon where she works every day. By means of this business she is able to aid her family, struggling to supply their needs. Cinthia has, with much effort, been able to build up her business: Little by little, it is growing due to her efforts.

Today, Cinthia is requesting her loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for her business, such as shampoo, rinses, hair coloring, creams and other items. This will enable her to continue offering her customers good service while carrying on the struggle to improve her income.

loans.use: buy shampoo, rinses, hair coloring, creams and other beauty supplies.

loans.name: Shee

texts.en: Shee lives in Likoni, Kenya where she runs a transport business that has been in operation for the last five years. She is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Her business has grown, but her motorbikes need servicing. She learned of Milango through friends and joined so that she could save money and access funds for her business. She wants to build houses in the next five years so that she can become a landlord. The major challenges in her transport business are accidents, and police officers who can also be a menace.

loans.use: to service her motorbikes

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria resides with her family in Campo 1, Aurora, in Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer, while she manages her hog-raising business to make a living. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2012 and she gains access to microfinance services. It also helps her ability to engage in business. 

Gloria borrowed a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy livestock feed. She is hopeful of having an abundant harvest on their farm. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed.

loans.name: Akil

texts.en: Akil lives in Iraq. He is 48 years old, married and has six children, two of whom are employed and help their father provide for the family, while their siblings go to school. Akil runs a grocery store where he sells items such as drinks, snacks, dairy products and detergents. He has long experience in this field, because he used to help his father run a grocery store when he was a child. In 2008, Akil established his own business and has earned an excellent reputation in his neighborhood. He is requesting a loan for $2,400, and will use this loan to buy a generator for his grocery store and more items to sell. His goal is to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can provide his family with higher living standards.

loans.use: to buy a generator for his grocery store and more goods to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana, de 32 años de edad, tiene una tienda de ropa y calzado en Puerto Cabezas. Actualmente necesita un préstamo para ampliar la mercadería de su negocio. Ella vive en Unión de hecho estable, tiene tres hijos, menores de edad, quienes asisten a la escuela.

Comenzó a trabajar en la tienda de su mamá, cuando tenía la edad de 18 años decidió establecer su propio negocio. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y los prestamos anteriores que ha recibido de PANA PANA, ha logrado mejorar la vivienda, apoyar en la educación de sus hijos e incluso asumir los gastos de su propia educación.

En el futuro desea tener una nueva tienda, en la cual pueda vender celulares o ropa de marca.
texts.en:
Juana, 32, has a clothing and footwear shop in Puerto Cabezas. She needs a loan to increase her store merchandise.  She is in a civil union and has three children that are still minors and attend school.

She started working in her mother's shop and at the age of eighteen she decided to start her own business. Through the efforts of her work and the previous loans that she has received from PANA PANA, she has been able to improve her home, support her children's education, and even take on her own education expenses. 

In the future she would like to have a new store where she can sell mobile phones or brand-name clothing.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and footwear for her shop.

loans.name: Jesica's Group

texts.en:
Jesica's Group is comprised of six hard-working women. Jesica is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro, in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jesica has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Jesica has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to sell and will help Jesica to generate greater profits and take good care of her parents. Jesica hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up another branch of the same business. 

Jesica is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Las Guerreras Group

texts.es:
Las Guerreras es un grupo de la ciudad de Luque, está en su ciclo 2 del programa de comités, cada una de ellas está esforzando, una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sulli, quien vende chipas (alimento típico paraguayo) en forma ambulante, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que por medio de su sacrificio está ayudando a su familia y procura darle todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
La Sra. Sulli solicita de este crédito para la compra de chipa para su reventa, lo que le ayudará a tener a un buen producto para ayudar a su familia y también cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Las Guerreras” (The Warriors) is a group that is from the city of Luque and in its second loan cycle with the committee program.  Each member is putting in the effort.  One of the members is Sra. Sulli, who sells “chipas” (traditional Paraguayan cheese bread) as a street vendor.  She is a very hardworking person.  Through her sacrifice, she is helping her family by providing everything they need so that they are not deprived.  

Sra. Sulli is requesting a loan in order to buy cheese bread that she can resell.  This will help her to have a good product so that she can help her family and also satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy Paraguayan cheese bread to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 26 years old and earns a living by roaming from place to place to sell her fruits and vegetables. Her goal is to get a better business location so that she can increase her sales and work at one place. However, she does not currently have enough money to do this. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy various vegetables like cabbage, beans, eggplants, squash and onions, and also some fruits to sell. This is how she will improve her business and provide a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Nakatudde Servers Group

texts.en: Florence is a new client and in her first loan cycle. She is a widow and has two children. She operates a restaurant in the Wandegeya neighbourhood of Kampala.
