The purpose of this UGX 400,000 loan is to buy a fridge in order to increase her income by selling cold, fresh drinks to her customers. Florence is an honest, hard-working lady who wishes to borrow more money after this loan to expand her restaurant business thereby increasing her income. Her hope is to buy a plot of land to build a house, to be able to save money for rent, and to expand her business. She and the other group members thank Ugafode for being supportive of their businesses.

loans.use: to buy a fridge.

loans.name: Jeffry Lorena

texts.es:
Jeffry es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, es una persona alegre, emprendedora. tiene 27 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos pequeños niños. Desde hace un año ha establecido su pequeño negocio de panadería, inicio a producir pan con 25 libras de harina, actualmente elabora pan con 150 libras de harina al día.

Recientemente, solicita financiamiento para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, ampliarlo y comprar más productos tales como harina, azúcar, levadura, etc. Por medio de los ingresos que perciba de su negocio piensa continuar apoyando en el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jeffry is from Puerto Cabezas. She is a cheerful and enterprising person. She is 27 years old, married, and has two small children. A year ago she set up her own small bakery business and began producing bread with 25 pounds of flour. Currently she makes bread with 150 pounds of flour a day. 

Recently she requested a loan to improve the infrastructure of her bakery, expand it, and buy more products such as flour, sugar, yeast, etc. By means of the income she earns from her business, she hopes to continue supporting her children's development.

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her bakery.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó con un dinero que le dio su esposo y fue comprando poco a poco hasta la actualidad, ahora ya tiene su negocio mucho más surtido.  Realiza sola sus labores, todos los días, desde temprano en la mañana.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja en un asadero de pollos.  Tiene 2 niños gemelos y estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  Quisiera comprar muchos más productos en el futuro, para poder ofrecerle más a sus clientes.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite y azúcar para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  She started out with some money that was given to her by her husband and she gradually bought enough inventory to the level she has today.  Now she has a business that is well-stocked.  She works alone every day, beginning in the early morning hours.  The borrower is married and her husband works as a chicken roaster.  They have two twin boys who attend a state school in the area.  In the future, she would like to buy more products so that she can offer more to her customers.  

For now the borrower needs this loan so that she can buy rice, oil, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: San Pedro 2 Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres integran este grupo llamado San Pedro 2, donde cada una de ellas está trabajando para poder capacitarse e ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zulma, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de discos Dvd, también se debe destacar el trabajo arduo de la señora y las ganas de salir adelante que tiene, ya que es una persona muy luchadora.
La Sra. Zulma Solicita de este crédito para la compra de discos Dvd para la venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Seventeen women are members of this group called San Pedro 2, where each of them is working to get training and improve their lives and those of their families.

One of the members is Zulma, who works buying and selling DVDs. It is worth emphasizing her hard work, as well as her desire to get ahead, since she is a fighter.

Zulma is requesting this loan to purchase DVDs to sell, which will help her to have a set business plan and improve her income. She is grateful for the help she is getting, which will be of great assistance to her.

loans.use: to buy DVDs to sell.

loans.name: Ykua Dure Group

texts.es:
Ykua Dure es un grupo muy trabajador, que se unió con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras y poder ayudar a sus familias. Quieren crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas.
Delia, una de las integrantes, quien es costurera, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza. Delia es una persona muy trabajadora, que con gran esfuerzo está logrando salir adelante.
La señora Delia solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, y así seguir trabajando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
“Ykua Dure” is a hardworking group in which the members have joined together so that they can help one another and help their families.  They want to grow, not only financially, but also as people.  

Delia, one of the members, is a seamstress.  What should also be mentioned is the work of the advisors who are constantly monitoring the training and follow-up.  At the same time, they encourage the women to push forward as they seek to overcome poverty.  Delia is a hardworking individual.  With great effort she has been able to forge ahead. 

Sra. Delia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fabrics and thread.  This will enable her to continue working so that she can improve her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El progreso está en su segundo ciclo, las integrantes se fijaron como meta crecer y ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder conseguir la meta de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Arminda, quien tiene venta de plantas y planteras, comenta que por medio de su negocio ella ido mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Es una persona que lucha y quiere poder crecer en su negocio, y así seguir ayudando a su familia.
La Sra. Arminda solicita de este crédito para la compra de planteras y de esa forma poder revenderlas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "El Progreso" communal bank is in their second cycle. The members have a goal, which is to grow and to help each other meet their individual goals. One of these people is Arminda, who sells plants and pots for plants. She comments that through her business she has improved her life as well as that of her family. She is a fighter and wants to expand her business, so as to continue to help her family. 

Arminda is requesting this loan to buy planters thus being able to re-sell them. Which will help her carry-out her business plan, which will help to increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy plant pots for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 49 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mercy has been farming rice for 28 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ivy Claire

texts.en:
Ivy Claire is 32 years old and a mother of two. With determination and hard work, she is able to provide for her children's needs through the net profits from her clothing sales business. She has been managing this business for six years, and is doing her best to provide her family with a comfortable life.

Ivy Claire wants to improve her business to save for her family's needs and the future education of her children, as well as to help her business grow. She is a requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more shirts, blouses, shorts, pants, and dresses. She hopes to use this requested amount to increase her customer satisfaction.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, blouses, shorts, pants and dresses.

loans.name: Phoeurt's Group

texts.en:
Phoeurt is 52 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is dependent on the family. She is from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. Phoeurt's primary source of income is rice farming, which she has been doing for 10 years. Her daily income Is about 21,700 KHR.  Her husband supplements the income by raising ducks. 

Phoeurt’s group consists of two members and they are requesting their first loan from VisionFund.  Phoeurt will use her portion to purchase more ducks.  She hopes that she can earn more income so as she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ducks

loans.name: Savan

texts.en:
Savan, 33, is married and lives with her husband and five children in the village of Battambang province. Two of her children are still in school while another one is too young for school and they are dependent on her. 

She and her husband are rice farmers. She has been in the rice farming business for 16 years. The main challenge for her family’s business is the lack of capital to buy fertilizer to better grow her crops. 

Savan is a first-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has been operating a motorcycle business. She faces a major challenge of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. She dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing herself.

With the loan of KES 50,0000, she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her business motorcycle.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Pyapy Mbarete está en su Primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de las 16 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero trabajando por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Noelia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con bajos ingresos, pero consciente de que debe seguir trabajando.  Ella se dedica a la peluquería y con su crédito quiere comprar productos en mayor cantidad de esmaltes y materiales variados para abaratar los costos.  Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo todas las integrantes.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Kuña Pyapy Mbarete" is in their first cycle with the Woman's Committee Program. They all promise to work and help each other to get ahead. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight program. Four of the sixteen women are below the poverty line, that is to say with very low income. But they are working to improve their lives.

One of these women is Noelia, who in the survey showed up with a poverty level one, that is indicating low income. But she is conscious that she must continue working. She does hairdressing and with her loan wants to buy greater quantities of nail polish and various materials so as to lower her costs. 

All the members are grateful for the opportunity they have been given.

loans.use: to buy nail polish and various materials.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia's previous loan helped her not just with her business but also in the education of her children. One of her children graduated already and is now working. Julia's business is useful for her everyday expenses at home. With the help of her husband, she runs the business and manages their household.

Julia would like to apply for another loan of 24,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at her store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will help to sustain her family's daily needs and to provide for her children's educational expenses. Julia looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julia dreams of having more customers and hopes to make a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15-30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a mother of three children who are attending school. Her husband is a farmer, while she is into vending vegetables in the market. She and her husband plant various kinds of vegetables in their field, and during their harvest, she is the one selling those harvested vegetables in the market. She also imports vegetables from various farmers producing them to sell while waiting for their own harvest.
 
She wishes for the continued operation of her business. With this, Julita is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy vegetables from vegetable producers in different villages near her place, then sell them in the market. 

She hopes to increase her income and be able to sustain her children school allowances for them to continue, and someday finish, their studies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables from vegetable producers in different villages near her place then sell them in the market.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas esta en el cuarto ciclo, todas sus integrantes son muy trabajadoras y unidas.  Son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona en crecimiento y eminentemente rural.
Todas las integrantes se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, cabras y demás.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Olga, quien solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y luchando para dar lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" is in their fourth cycle. All the members are hardworking and united. They are from the city of  Santaní, an eminently rural area that is growing. All of the members are involved with the raising and sales of farm animals such as chickens, pigs, goats, etc. 

One of the members is Olga, who is requesting this loan to invest it in buying balanced feed. Doing so she will be able to continue working and fighting to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La Señora Wilma  es comerciante, vende todo tipo de muñecas en una de las  ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, vive  en la casa de su hermana, en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo necesita para incrementar de su capital, comprar más muñecas y  de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Wilma es que su negocio crezca y tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Wilma runs a business selling all types of dolls in one of El Alto’s markets. She lives with her sister in the Miraflores area of La Paz.

Wilma is seeking a loan to buy more dolls so she can increase her income. Her dreams are to see her business grow and to have a house of her own.

loans.use: buy more dolls to sell in the town of El Alto

loans.name: Peninnah

texts.en:
Peninnah is a married woman with four children. Three of her children are in school and one is underage. The family lives in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Peninnah sells fruits and coconuts. She cites transportation costs as a major challenge. She is requesting for a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase oranges, bananas and coconuts for resale. 

Peninnah joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
Age 52, Hean is a rice and corn farmer who does farming on one a half hectares of her farmland as a main source of family income. She is residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province with three children. 

She has been in this business for 30 years and earns about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the daily costs. Hean is a first-cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Now she is the group leader of three group members. They are requesting a total loan amount of 2,600,000 KHR from which 1,000,000 KHR is Hean’s loan amount. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to double her crop yield so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

James is married, and has nine children and many grandchildren. His wife is a retired nurse, while he himself has retired to focus on farming. He has been farming for fifty-five years, and is currently growing maize, vegetables and bananas on his land. James likes beekeeping because it does not require a lot of hard work, but still creates income. 

This is James’ first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to take care of himself, his wife and his grandchildren. His hope for the future is “to live happily with my family.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Margielou

texts.en:
Margielou is married and have five children residing in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is engaged in a buy-and-sell business, selling cosmetics and RTW products (ready-to-wear clothing) to make a living. 

She joined GDMPC in 2012 to gain access to micro finance services of the cooperative. She borrowed a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional cosmetics and repair the motorcycle used in her business.

She hopes to gain more profit in return of her investments for the better living of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics and repair the motorcycle used in her business.

loans.name: Moreen's Group

texts.en:
Moreen's group is comprised of five hardworking women. Moreen is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Moreen has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items such as water, milk and salt to sell, and will help Moreen to generate greater profits and take good care of herself. Moreen hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to puchase more items such as water, milk and salt to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald trabaja como ayudante de construcción, , vive en la casa de sus padres, en la zona de Valle Hermoso de la ciudad de La Paz. También tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de radios para movilidades.
El crédito lo necesita para  incrementar de su capital, adquiriendo radios para movilidades  a precios económicos los cuales los adquiere en la frontera, comercializándolos en  las paradas de los minibuses.

El sueño de Ronald es culminar sus estudios universitarios ya que este año termina su bachillerato y piensa estudiar contabilidad.
texts.en:
Ronald works as a helper on a construction site. He lives with his parents in the Valle Hermoso area of the city of La Paz. He also runs a small business selling car radios.

He now needs a loan to buy more radios at low prices which he obtains at the border and then sells at minibus stops.

Ronald’s dream is to complete his university education which should happen this year. He is thinking of then taking accounting courses.

loans.use: to buy car radios at wholesale prices and then sell them to car owners

loans.name: Konitha

texts.en: Konitha is 27 years old and the young mother of one child. To make a living, she works as a paid worker at a garment factory, which gives her about 30,700 KHR per day to spend on daily expenses in her household. Konitha has never been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, before. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy a decent motorbike for commuting. She hopes that this purchase will help her to reduce the transportation cost which she used to have and use that money to take care of her child instead.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Polly

texts.en: Polly is 60 years of age and a farmer who has done this since 2003. He has ten children and the youngest of the ten is aged eight years. He does his farming in a rural area of Kanyabwanga-Mitooma District and he says he started farming so that he could have a sure source of income. In addition to the money he gets from his farming business he also gets monthly pension money which supports his family a lot. He says his major clients are banana traders in his area and that he would like to use the money to buy mulch and manure so that he can have better harvests. Polly says his major challenge is the weather which changes a lot and in most cases affects the harvests negatively. He describes himself as a hardworking man who has high hopes of becoming financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy mulch and organic manure

loans.name: Sharon

texts.es:
La Señora Sharon es comerciante, vende mantas de hilo para señoras de pollera, vive  en la casa de sus familiares, en la zona Valle Hermoso de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo necesita para incrementar de su capital, adquiriendo mercadería de temporada (mantas de hilo de diferentes colores) y  de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Sharon  es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para dejar de vivir en  la casa de sus familiares y mejorar el nivel de vida en su familia.

esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Sharon is a businesswoman. She sells knit shawls made for women who wear "polleras" (traditional skirts worn by mestizo and the rural indigenous women). She lives in the house of relatives in the Valle Hermoso area of La Paz. Sharon needs the loan to increase her working capital, buying seasonal merchandise (knit shawls of different colors). In this way she can increase her revenues. Sharon's dream is to save enough money to be able to move out of her relative's house and improve the living standard of her family. This is the second loan she has taken out through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy knit shawls.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de celulares los cuales los adquiere en la frontera, vive en anticretico con su mama, en la zona de Escobar Uria de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo necesita para incrementar de su capital, adquiriendo nuevos modelos de celular y  de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos. Todavia se dedica tambien a mantenimiento de computadoras.

El sueño de Rodrigo es poder comprar su casa propia y culminar sus estudios superiores.
esta es la segunda vez que su credito va a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Rodrigo runs a business selling cell phones which he obtains at the border. He rents a room in his mother’s house in the Escobar Uria area of the city of La Paz.

He now needs a loan to buy new cellphone models so he can increase his income. Rodrigo also earns money servicing computers.

His dreams are to buy his own house and complete his further education.

This is his second loan with Kiva.

loans.use: buy new cellphone models to sell to his customers

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 54-year-old, married father of five children. 

He has a shop where he sells spare car parts. He is his family’s sole breadwinner, that’s why he is a hard-worker who puts so much effort into continuing to improve and develop his business. Hussein has 26 years of experience in this domain, which provides him with customers' trust and support.  

Hussein is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase his spare parts capital in order to expand his business. Hussein has future plans for expanding his business through opening another branch.

loans.use: to increase his spare parts capital in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромату 56 лет. Он родился в Шахритусе и до сих пор проживает там со своей семьей. Каромат занимается земледелием. Он на своем участке земли выращивает сельскохозяйственную культуру. Чтобы улучшить бюджет семьи он собирается параллельно начать новую деятельность по откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Он будет держать животных у себя дома, на скотном дворе. Когда придут холода его коровы и быки будут переждать зиму в коровнике. У Каромат есть все условия для начала и развития бизнеса скотоводства. Его начальный капитал составляет 3000 таджикских сомони. Каромат надеется, очень надеется на финансирование. Если у него будет достаточной суммы денег, он сможет приобрести 5 голов бычков и их корм и начать свой бизнес по откорму и продаже скота.
texts.en: Karomat is 56 years old.  He was born in Shahrituz and lives there with his family to this day.  Karomat is involved in farming.  He grows agricultural crops on his land plot.  In order to improve his family's budget, he is planning to start a new parallel business in feeding and selling cattle.  He will keep animals at home, on a livestock yard.  His cows and bulls will weather the winter in a cowshed when the cold weather comes.  Karomat has all of the conditions for starting and developing the animal husbandry business.  His initial capital amounts to 3000 Tajik somoni.  Karomat hopes for and very much relies on the financing.  If he has enough money, he would be able to purchase five bulls and feed for them and start his business in feeding and selling livestock.

loans.use: to purchase five bulls and feed for them and start his business in feeding and selling livestock

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe vive en la zona de Ciudad Satelite de la ciudad de El Alto. Trabaja como educadora en un colegio particular. Guadalupe necesita el crédito para poder cancelar las mensualidades del instituto de su hijo que esta estudiando contaduria.

El sueño de Guadalupe es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para dejar de vivir como arrendataria y mejorar el nivel de vida en su familia y lograr que su hijo termine su carrera y pueda trabajar para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives in the area of Ciudad Satelite in the city of El Alto. She works as a teacher at a private school. Guadalupe needs the loan to pay the monthly fees of the institution where her son is studying accountancy.

Guadalupe's dream is to be able to have enough money so she does not have to live in rented accommodation and to improve the standard of living of her family as well as helping her son to finish his course so he can work to support his family.

loans.use: to pay monthly fees of the institution where her son is studying accountancy.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives close to Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas; with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old grown trees in the Kakamega forest,   and the variety of the crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Simon is married and has four children. His wife works as a secretary, while Simon engages in projects on their land. He has been farming for twenty years, and is currently undertaking dairy farming and growing maize and vegetables. He likes beekeeping because it generates income and allows him another source of revenue from his farm. 

This is Simon’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use it to pay his children’s school fees. In the future, Simon hopes to “be one of the best beekeeping farmers."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 25 years old and has two children. Haydar lives in his parent's house, and works hard to take care of both his parents and his family.

He owns a shop where he sells clothes for children of all ages. He established his business in 2010 and has gained great experience in what he practices. Haydar is well-known in the neighborhood and is respected by many.

Haydar is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. Haydar believes that this loan will give him the chance to continue providing for his family in the days to come, with the aim of improving the quality of his goods and growing his business even more.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his clothing shop.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo vive con sus padres en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es el de transportista en el sector público. Hugo necesita el crédito para realizar el mantenimieto de su herramieta de trabajo y así poder obtener trabajar sin problemas y poder cubrir con los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Hogo es poder acceder a la compra de un casa propia tener los ingresos económicos suficientes para poder brindar a sus hijos la calidad de vida a la cual el no pudo acceder.

Es la segunda vez que su crédito va a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Hugo lives with his parents in the Bajo Llojeta area of the city of la Paz. He works as a taxi driver. Hugo needs the loan to carry out maintenance on his vehicle which he uses for his work so he can get work without problems and cover his household running costs.

Hugo's dream is to be able to buy a house of his own and to have enough income to be able to give his children a quality of life which he has not had himself. This is the second time he has had a loan through Kiva,

loans.use: pay for the cost of maintaining his vehicle.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is 36 years old, married, and has four children. He is a farmer in Bugongi town, cell-Sheema District.

Asaph started farming in the year 2006 and he started, so he could have a clear source of income. In addition to farming, he also operates a small restaurant which gives him additional income. 

He would like to use the loan money of UGX 1,500,000 to buy mulch and manure, so he can improve his garden, allowing him to harvest more and, hence, get more income. 

Asaph's clients are mainly the local people and he strongly believes that he will be financially stable, despite the challenge of limited capital which he faces in his business. Asaph describes himself as a very hard-working man who has all the determination to succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and mulch.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old grown forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Gladys is married and has five children. Her husband is a casual worker with a local sugar company, while Gladys farms their land. She has been farming for three years, and is currently growing vegetables, maize, beans, and sorghum. Gladys likes beekeeping because it does not require hard work but still produces returns. 

This is Gladys’ first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to buy a dairy cow. Her hope for the future is to “buy more land and build a good house for my family.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Sarafina, who is in her early 30s, is married with a boy who is in school. For two years now, she has been running a retail shop selling rice, flour, beans, sugar, airtime, sweets, etc. She starts working at 6 am until 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair profit per month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Sarafina's fifth loan request, which will use to restock items missing from her shop inventory. She used her previous loans to buy more shop items like rice, flour, beans, sweets, etc. Sarafina has paid back all her previous loans successfully and used her profit to cover household expenses and school fees. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a wholesale shop. 

She will share this loan with her loan group " Hakika" which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items missing from her shop inventory.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items, such as water, milk, and salt to sell, and will help Gorret generate greater profits and take care of herself. Gorret hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as water, milk, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, se dedica a ofrecer servicios de catering. Roger necesita el crédito para poder comprar insumos de cocina y herramientas de trabajo como ser vajillas, cubiertos y otros para  el ambiente  donde realiza este servicio para así atraer a más clientela, obteniendo mayor utilidad y poder cubrir con los gastos que tiene ya que el siempre esta actualizándose en su profesión como chef.

El sueño de Roger es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para abrir un restaurante propio, incrementando sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roger lives in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. He provides a catering service. Roger needs the loan to buy kitchen supplies and tools of the trade such as crockery, cutlery and other items for the place where he offers this service. This way he will attract more customers, get better profits and be able to cover the cost of constantly keeping his skills as a professional chef up to date.

Roger's dream is to get enough money together to open a restaurant of his own, thus increasing his income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy crockery, cutlery and other items so he can serve his customers better in his catering business.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is married, with three children. She resides in Balili, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Her husband is a farmer, while she runs a retail store to make a living. 

Cecille joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2012 and, now, she is borrowing a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional grocery items, like canned goods and bottled products. She always wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items, like canned goods and bottled products.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is a single Iraqi youth client who is 28 years old. He lives with his family, which is composed of four members. Hussain works hard to provide for his family all by himself. 

Hussain owns a carpenter’s shop. He has been practicing carpentry for more than six years. He specializes in making furniture. Hussain established his own business in 2008 and has gained good experience in this field. He now has an employee and is well-known in his neighborhood, thanks to his competitive prices. 

Hussain is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a wood-cutting machine. Hussain is aiming to expand in this field and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a wood-cutting machine

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda's last loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy the needed products for her store, and her store is continuously expanding and growing. As a single woman, she is working hard to provide for her everyday needs. She is also helping her family financially.

She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan to buy raw ingredients, grocery items, fish, pork, and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nilda dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a better life. She meets with her co-fellowship members* weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients, grocery items, fish, pork, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Shaymardan

texts.ru: Шаймардан 57 летний фермер, проживающий в районе Шахритус. Его характер и стиль жизни полностью соответствует значению его имени, что означает сильный, смелый и миролюбивый человек. Отец Шаймардана был фермером, и он унаследовал профессию отца. Он с детства работал на земле и знает, что землеводство требует не малый труд. Шаймардан уже 12 лет как выращивает лук, кукурузу, рис для продажи. Вся его семья помогает ему в деятельности. За эти годы он расширил участок орошаемой земли. В течении двух лет он с дехканского хозяйства арендует 2 га участок земли. В данное время он на 0,40 га участке земли посеял рис, на 1 га земли кукурузу, а на остальном участке он собирается посеять лук. С такой целью Шаймардан обратился за кредитом. Он хочет приобрести семян лука, минеральных удобрений и топлива. Шаймардан с надеждой смотрит вперед в будущее, и видит там богатый урожай и смело идет к своей цели.
texts.en: Shaymardan is a 57 year-old farmer who lives in the Shahritus region. His character and lifestyle completely correspond to the meaning of his name, which means strong, brave and peace-loving person. Shaymardan's father was a farmer, and he inherited his father's profession. Since childhood, he has worked  the land and knows that farming requires no small effort. For the past 12 years, Shaymardan has grown onions, corn, rice for sale. His whole family helps him with this work. Over the years, he has expanded the area of productive land. Over the course two years, he has been renting a 2 hectare plot of land . Currently, he has planted rice on a .40 hectare plot of land, corn on a 1 hectare plot of land, and is planning to plant onions on the remaining land. To that end, Shaymardan has applied for a loan. He wants to buy onion seeds, fertilizer and fuel. Shaymardan is looking forward to the future with hope, sees there a rich harvest, and boldly goes toward his goals.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, fuel and onion seeds

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 40,000 to buy more stocks of nails and paints for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nails and paints for resale in her hardware shop.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
This is Rachel. She previously accessed a loan that she used to purchase a new motorcycle. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for her personal, household, and business expenditures. Rachel also operates a retail shop that she wants to stock.

She would like to apply for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy cooking oil, soap, wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour for resale.  She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, soap, wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a 28-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, two children and parents in the Gurjaani district in eastern Georgia. 

Davit is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a vineyard and peach trees. He works hard and always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers at a good price. 

Davit requested a loan to start his own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,500 GEL for trading fruits and vegetables. Davit will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables and then sell them at higher price, which will increase his income.

loans.use: to begin trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda was born in 1980. She is married and a mother of four. Her husband is an artistic supervisor at a private company. Raeda lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat. 

Raeda has been sewing and doing embroidery for two years. She started her project with a small amount of money and found it profitable. She is planning to open her own sewing and embroidery workshop in the future. She currently wants to buy fabrics and embroidery machines in order to be more productive and to increase her profits and income to support her husband financially, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan. 

As Raeda is a conservative woman, she asked her husband's wife, who is helping her in her project, to appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and embroidery machines to do her work.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is at the age of 47, she belongs to the middle standard family, and she is passing her life with her spouse and four children. Her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband earns a sufficient amount, and easily affords the household expenses and school fee for his children. He owns a shop in which he offers services to fix the glasses in windows panes and windows wooden frames. He has to convince his customers for good quality and color glass; his convincing way is very impressive. For his services, sometimes he has to go out of city also. 

Nowadays, his customers demand designed-over glass, which he does not have in the stock. He wants to buy such designed-over glass but does not have sufficient amount to purchase. Therefore, Kalsoom requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy designed wise glasses to offer his customers. 

She is very hopeful the Kiva lenders would support her in this fund raising. Kalsoom is very thankful to Kiva and it's field partner, BARC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy designed glass of different categories for windows panes.

loans.name: Kagongo Tweyombekye Group

texts.en:
Regina is a single mother who lost her husband in 2008. She has three children and also takes care of her brother's two sons whose mother ran away from home, leaving them alone.

She runs a small drug store with limited capital where she earns income to look after the family. She applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to add more stock to her drug store, so as to increase her working capital. She will use the rest of the money to pay her children's school fees. Her customers are neighbors and a few outsiders.

She is a very hardworking lady despite the fact that she has a few challenges, like insufficient capital to expand her business, and the fact that it affects her cash flow when her children fall sick.

loans.use: to buy drugs for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 35-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children attending school. She has owned a bakery since 2010, where she produces appetizing pastries. 

Maha works really hard in cooperation with her husband, who works outside Lebanon to help the family live in good conditions. Today, given that her children will enter school very soon, Maha is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them at school and purchase their books. 

The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation and help them become able to get good jobs that will give them a good income.

loans.use: to register her children at school and purchase their books.

loans.name: Juma

texts.ru: Джуме 51 год. Он из города Турсунзаде. В этом городке Джума родился, вырос и женился. Сейчас он отец троих детей. Джума владеет земельным  участком, где выращивает овощи, в том числе помидоры, огурцы, баклажаны, перец, морковь и многое другое. Посевом овощей Джума занимается на протяжении 7 лет. Ему помогают жена и невестка. Джуме срочно нужны средства для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Он должен обработать посеянные овощи, чтобы собрать хороший качественный урожай.
texts.en: Juma is 51 years old. He is from the town of Tursunzoda. In this town, Juma was born, grew up and married. Now, he is the father to three children. Juma owns the land where he grows vegetables, including tomatoes, cucumbers, eggplant, peppers, carrots, and more. Juma has been growing vegetables for  for 7 years. His wife and daughter help him with this. Juma urgently needs funds for the purchase of fertilizer. He needs to fertilize the planted vegetables to have a quality harvest.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for growing vegetables

loans.name: Sayli

texts.ru: Сайли 46 лет. Она живет с мужем и детьми в городе Турсунзаде, расположенный в центрально-западной части Таджикистана. Сайли очень занятой человек. Она занимается куплей и продажей тканей и материалов. Сайли покупает ткани оптом и продает свою продукцию жителям деревней, сёл и других глубинок. Сайли сама совершает покупку и сама  раздает товар. Это не легкая работа, но она прекрасно справляется. Таким видом деятельности Сайли занимается более 20 лет и хочет дальше развивать свой бизнес. Сайли просит кредит, чтобы закупить новые ткани для осенней одежды и перепродать их в далеких селах.
texts.en: Sayli is 46 years old. She lives with her ​​husband and children in Tursunzoda, located in the mid-western part of Tajikistan. Sayli is a very busy person. She buys and sells fabrics and materials. Sayli buys fabric in bulk and sells her products to residents of villages and other remote areas. Sayli herself makes a purchase, then distributes the merchandise. This is not an easy job, but she is very capable . Sayli has been engaged in this business for more than 20 years and wants to continue to grow it. Sayli has requested a loan to buy new fabrics for autumn clothes and resell them in the remote villages.

loans.use: For the purchase and resale of fabrics

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor vive en casa propia en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de empleado en una chapería de vehículos. Victor necesita el crédito para poder comprar pintura para un trabajo que tiene  y así poder obtener mayores beneficios y poder cubrir con los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Victor es poder instalar su propio taller, pues aún con el crédito anterior el taller todavía no está completamente instalado, y asi  tener los ingresos económicos suficientes para poder cubrir sus gastos cuando ya sea mayor de edad.
Esta es la segunda vez que trabajará con kiva y la tercera con IMPRO.
texts.en:
Victor lives in his own house, which is made of brick with a cement floor, in the area of Bajo Llojeta in the city of La Paz. He has a job as an employee at a vehicle repair workshop. He needs the loan to buy paint for a job he has so he can make better profits and cover his household costs.

Victor's dream is to have his own workshop, as even with the previous loan the workshop is not completely finished, and then he will have enough income to cover his costs when he is older. This will be his second loan with Kiva and third with IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy paint for a job painting a vehicle.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира родилась в 1984 году в сельской местности. Она добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Элмира вышла замуж и родила двоих детей. Однако после нескольких лет семейной жизни, она развелась с мужем. Она осталась одна с 2 маленькими детьми. Она не имела работу и поэтому уехала в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. После нескольких лет она опять вернулась на родину и начала свой бизнес. Элмира уже более 3 лет занимается купле продажей сельхоз культур. Рабочий день Элмиры начинается с раннего утра и заканчивается поздно вечером. Элмира старается улучшить условию проживания для своих детей. Она не имеет квартиру и поэтому хочет купить квартиру. С такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки квартиры. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Elmira was born in 1984 in a rural area. She is a kind and hardworking woman. Elmira got married and had two children. However, after several years of marriage, she and her husband divorced. She was left alone with two small children. She had no job and so went to Russia to make a living. After several years, she again returned to her homeland and started a business. Elmira has over 3 years of experience in buying and selling produce. Elmira's working day starts in the early morning and ends late at night. Elmira is trying to improve the living conditions for her children. She does not have an apartment and therefore wants to buy an apartment. With this goal, she has applied for a loan. She has requested a loan of 7500 Somons to buy an apartment. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a flat

loans.name: Heba

texts.en: Heba was born in 1991. She is married and has three daughters. Her husband is in the military. Heba has been selling oil treatment products, perfumes and soaps for a year. She is planning to expand her business more by selling a larger amount of her products. Now she is seeking to add new products to her business in order to raise her profit and income and to be a good financial support for her husband and children. She is planning to buy makeup and hair dryers to sell, but she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy makeup and hair dryers to expand her product line

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Шарофат всегда обеспечивала семью сама, так как ее муж не работает и не старается помогать жене. Шарофат более 20 лет занимается скотоводством. Она трудится упорно, чтобы зарабатывать деньги. Ее дети помогают ей по откармливанию скота. Она кроме скотоводства работает разнорабочим, то есть помогает людям по уборке дома или сбора урожая и получает за это деньги. Она планирует увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом развевать бизнес. Она не имеет денег, чтобы купить скота. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки скота. Она раньше кредитовалась в  других банках и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sharofat is a conscientious woman. She is married and raising four children. Sharofat has always provided for the family by herself, because her husband does not work and does not try to help her. Sharofat more than 20 years of experience in animal husbandry. She works hard to earn money. Her children help her fatten the cattle. Other than working with livestock, she works as a handywoman, cleaning people's houses or harvesting crops for pay. She plans to increase her working capital and thus develop her business. She does not have the money to buy cattle. She has requested a loan of 3500 Somons for the purchase of cattle. She has previously taken out loans from other banks and has a good credit history. She is waiting for your kindness .

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase working capital

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 33-year-old lady and the mother of three children. Two of her children go to school, and one of them is too young. 

Shamim's husband is a sewing machine maker and provides services for repairing sewing machines as well. He is an expert in his work and has been doing this business for many years. He wants to build new sewing machines to sell but he does not have money to buy parts, such as buttonhole feet, overcast feet, zipper feet, blind stitch feet, button fitting feet, bobbins, spring action quilting feet, quilt guides, etc. Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan to buy sewing machine parts so that her husband can earn maximum profit for his family. 

Shamim is very thankful to the Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine parts for her husband's sewing machine business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past year, Margret has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, and salt. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase items such as water, milk, and salt to sell. It will help Margret to generate greater profits and take care of her child. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase items such as water, milk, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani is a 28-year-old Lebanese, engaged woman. She has worked as a nurse since 2009. She works independently serving patients at their homes. In parallel, she works at a local hospital to earn as much income as she can to help her fiance save for their living expenses, especially their upcoming wedding costs. With this requested youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Amani will update her medical tools so that she can better serve her patients and help them to heal faster. In the future, Amani is eager to open a pharmacy and she states that a new Kiva loan will assist her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to update her medical tools.

loans.name: Mbete

texts.en: Mbete appreciates her previous loan, which helped to improve her living standards. The loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income which she used to take care of her family. She would like to apply for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy additional stocks of fruit such as oranges and mangoes to sell. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruit such as oranges and mangoes to sell

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam was born in 1950. She is a widowed woman who has two children. 

For the past four years, Mariam has been trying her best to support her children and herself by selling foodstuffs from her house. She started her business by selling a small quantity of her products in a small room at her house. Then, she started to slowly expand the business. In the future, she plans to open her own supermarket, near her house. 

Now, she needs to buy a larger quantity of foodstuffs and drinks in order to raise her profit and to improve her living conditions. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products for the store.

loans.name: Nazilkan

texts.ru: Назилкан 55 лет, вдова, одна воспитывает четверых детей. Назилкан имеет среднее образование, на протяжении 15 лет занимается швейным производством. Изготавливает и реализовывает национальные изделия, одежду, приданное для невест. Имеет большой опыт работы в данной сфере. Назилкан наработала достаточный опыт и клиентов в своей сфере. На центральном рынке, по месту своего проживания, Назилкан имела свой небольшой цех по пошиву национальных изделий и предоставляла 15 рабочих мест для населения. Бизнес шел успешно, но 28 января 2013 года произошел пожар внутри цеха, пожар не удалось погасить во время, и бизнес клиента полностью сгорел, а это: сам цех, оборудования, материалы, ткани, фурнитура. К счастью, никто из людей не пострадал. Но Назилкан не сдалась в такой тяжелой ситуации, она стойко и мужественно все это перенесла, а потом собрав все свои силы вновь упорно стала работать над восстановлением своего бизнеса. Многолетний опыт, мужественный характер и близкие помогли Назилкан встать на ноги. После пожара прошло 8 месяцев, Назилкан за это время смогла установить новый контейнер, в котором работают 4 швеи. Бизнес постепенно налаживается, Назилкан мечтает и дальше развить и укрепить свой бизнес, а для продвижения бизнеса Назилкан нуждается в денежных средствах для покупки тканей для пошива национальной одежды, словом она хочет пополнить и увеличить товарооборот. Назилкан услышав о льготной программе КИВА "Форс-Мажор" обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку тканей для пошива национальных изделий. Изучив бизнес план Назилкан: она сможет получать около 20,000 KGS в месяц. Доходы от кредита Назилкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса. Назилкан очень рада, что существует такая программа, и благодарит всех инвесторов КИВА и Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры».
texts.en: Nazilkan is 55 years old, a widow and raising four children by herself.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in sewing for 15 years.  She makes and sells national goods, clothing and dowry for brides.  She has a lot of work experience in this business.  Nazilkan gained sufficient experience and clients in this business.  Nazilkan had her own small, national-dress sewing factory at the central market, which provided 15 jobs for people.  The business was running well, but a fire happened inside the factory on January 28, 2013.  It was impossible to put the fire out in time, and the business burned down completely, including the factory itself, equipment, materials, fabrics and accessories.  Luckily, none of the people were hurt.  Nazilkan did not give up in this difficult situation.  She strongly got through this and then, putting all of her efforts together, started to work hard to restore her business.  The multi-year experience, strong character and relatives helped Nazilkan to get back on her feet.  Eight months have passed since the fire, and Nazilkan was able to install a new a container, where 4 seamstresses work.  The business is gradually improving, and Nazilkan dreams to further develop and strengthen her business.  Nazilkan needs money to purchase fabrics for sewing national clothing and increase her goods turnover.  Having heard about the favorable Kiva “Force-Major” program, Nazilkan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank “Bai-Tushum and Partners” to purchase fabrics for sewing national goods.   Based on her business plan, Nazilkan would earn about 20,000 KGS per month.  She plans to invest the earnings into further increasing her business.  Nazilkan is very happy that this program exists and thanks all of the Kiva and microfinance bank “Bai-Tushum and Partners” investors.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing national goods

loans.name: Etihad

texts.en: Etihad is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Etihad was born in 1965. She is married and a mother of two children. Her husband works in agriculture. Etihad currently works as a teacher. Her son is a student who is in his first year of study for a Bachelor of Accounting. He is planning to work in her field after graduation in order to help support his family financially. Etihad doesn't currently have enough money to pay her son's upcoming semester fees because she is facing financial problems. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Joselyne's Group

texts.en:
Joselyne's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Joselyne is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Joselyne has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells second-hand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Joselyne has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Joselyne to generate greater profits and take good care of her parents. Joselyne hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business more. 

Joselyne is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn operates her hog raising business while her husband farms on their own farm. She always find ways to augment their living and to support the needs of her five children. She joined GDMPC in 2012 and recently Jocelyn borrowed a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase feed for her livestock. Her profit was set aside for the expansion of her piggery.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru:
Гулноза девушка активная. Ей 31 год. Замужем. У нее трое детишек. Муж Гулнозы Бунед не давно уехал в Россию на заработки. Раньше он занимался откормом скота и перепродавал их. Сама Гулноза девушка с большой фантазией. Мастер на все руки. Со школы она увлекалась шитьем,вышивала разные платки и платья. И до сих пор продолжает свой труд. 
Гулноза также параллельно управляет магазином. Она у себя в селе открыла магазин детской одежды и парфюмерии. На сегодняшней день её бизнес развивается хорошо, сельские местности постепенно привыкают к ней к её магазину. Гулноза хотела бы увеличить объем товара и разнообразить свой ассортимент одежды. Для этого ей нужны денежные средства. Поэтому она  за кредитом обратилась в  организацию Арванд. По словам знакомых Гулнозы, она очень ответственный и пунктуальный человек и  " Арванд"  конечно же приветствует таких клиентов и поддержит Гулнозу.
texts.en: Gulnoza is an active young woman.  She is 31 years old, married and has three children.  Gulnoza's husband, Buned, recently went to Russia for work.  Previously, he was involved in feeding and selling livestock.  Gulnoza is a young woman with a lot of imagination.  She is very handy.  Since school she was interested in sewing and embroidered various scarves and dresses.  She continues this work to this day.  Concurrently, Gulnoza manages a store.  She opened a children's clothing and perfume store in her village.  Today, her business is growing well and the village residents are gradually getting used to her and her store.  Gulnoza wants to increase the volume of her merchandise and to vary the selection of clothing.  She needs money for this.  This is why she requested a loan from the Arvand organization.  According to Gulnoza's friends, she is a very responsible and punctual person, and Arvand certainly approves of such clients and will support Gulnoza.

loans.use: to increase the volume of her merchandise and to vary the selection of clothing

loans.name: Telman

texts.en: Telman is 45 years old. He is married and has one son. Telman is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits, in order to support his family. Telman ’s income from business is 130 AZN. In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his son will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 1800 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming autumn, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Kinyikita

texts.en: Kinyikita is 45 years old, married to Korieta, and blessed with six children. Kinyikita has been in this business for the last four years with a monthly income of KES 40,000. She has qualified to get her first loan from KADET LTD of KES 30,000 which she plans to use for purchase of more beads. The anticipated profit she will use to buy sheep and goats. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase more beads

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega County. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and the concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Daniel is married and has ten children. Both he and his wife have been farming for twenty years, and are currently growing maize, yams and sweet potatoes on their land. Daniel thinks that beekeeping is a good project because “it’s cheap, it’s harvested at least three times per year so that means more income.”

This is Daniel’s first loan with Kiva.  He plans to use the income from his hives to pay primary and secondary school fees for his children. His hope for the future is to “buy more land and educate my kids to a higher level.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Carmila

texts.en:
This is Carmila, 43, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a construction worker, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carmila is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness. She also sells pork.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day.

Carmila hopes to be successful in her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more variety of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Zamiq

texts.en:
Zamiq is 32 years old. He is married and has a one daughter. Zamiq lives with his family in an internally displaced persons (IDP) settlement, as he is an IDP. 

Zamiq raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. He has eight years of experience. Despite the short period he has been in this business, Zamiq has gained respect from local vendors because he produces a good organic crop without chemical fertilizers. Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijani family's table and also are used to make fresh punch.

Zamiq sells his crops from his yard and sometimes takes them to the local bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. He would like to expand his business and purchase more seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of his crops to increase his sales. For this purpose, Zariq applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. This will be his fifth loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to improve the quality of his crops to increase his sales.

loans.name: Bahemuka's Group

texts.en:
Bahemuka's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Bahemuka is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Bahemuka has been working hard to manage her small food stall, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Bahemuka has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food, such as raw bananas and sweet potatoes, to add to her business. This will help Bahemuka to generate greater profits and develop her business more. Bahemuka hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Bahemuka is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more fresh food, such as raw bananas and sweet potatoes, to add to her business.

loans.name: Iklim

texts.ru: Иклим добрая и порядочная женщина. После трагической смерти мужа, ее семье было очень трудно. Ее старший сын учился в последнем курсе в университете, а второй сын служил в армии. Ей было необходимо найти работу и прокормить семью. Она долго думала, как зарабатывать деньги и наконец, она решила организовать свой бизнес, купле продажей молочных продуктов. Она привозила молочные продукты с своего района на городской рынок и продавала там. Постепенно она развевала бизнес и начала дополнительный бизнес, скотоводством. Она помогла сыну окончить университет и смогла прокормить своих детей в трудные минуты. Иклим целеустремленная и сильная женщина. Постепенно она улучшает условию проживания. Она хочет купить мебель для своей семье. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Iklim is a kind and decent woman.  After her husband's tragic death, it was very hard for her family.  Her oldest son is attending his last year in a university, and the second son is serving in the army.  She had to find work and feed the family.  She thought for a long time how to earn money and finally decided to organize her own business in buying and selling dairy products.  She brought dairy products from her district to the city market and sold them there.  Gradually she developed her business and started an additional business in animal husbandry.  She helped her son to finish the university and was able to support two children in difficult times.  Iklim is a driven and strong woman.  She is gradually improving her living conditions.  She wants to purchase furniture for her family.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 somoni to purchase furniture.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Airene

texts.en: Airene runs a Pyrex product resale business to augment her husband's income. She has four children that need support so she always finds ways to augment their living. She joined GDMPC in 2012 and recently, she borrowed a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy more Pyrex products to resell. She plans to use her generated profit from the business to finance the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more pyrex products for resale

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 24 years old, a young client. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). He moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with his parents. He is a very successful entrepreneur who sells chickens and ducks, which brings him a stable income. Elchin is a very hardworking man. For the past 3 years, he has been raising chickens and ducks and is very active in poultry. He usually buys small ducks and chickens, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His father also helps him in this business because it is the only income for their family. From this business Elchin's monthly income is 120 AZN.

Elchin has already taken 3 loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for his fourth loan of 2000 AZN. With this money, he wants to invest in the business and buy more small chickens and ducks in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more small chickens and ducks

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarrat is 47 years old; she is the mother of ten children.

Her husband owns a firewood shop, in which he sells pieces of wood. He sells firewood mostly to the chefs who cook meals for ceremonies and events. He purchases wood and splits it into pieces with an axe. In his area a short fall of gas for home use often occurs in the winter season. This is the reason people like to use this firewood for cooking. Now the winter season is going to start and demand for firewood as well. He wants to buy woods to cut into small pieces to sell.

Therefore, Musarrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to earn maximum profit in this winter season.

loans.use: To buy woods to cut into firewood to sell.

loans.name: Sevindik

texts.en:
Sevindik is 53 years old. He is married and has three sons. He is an IDP and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sevindik has been breeding cattle and milk cows for the past 25 years.  He learned to operate a small business from his parents. He continued working in the same business after he was married. Through a lot of sacrifice, he has become one of the leading producers of agriculture for the area in which he lives. With the income from the business, he has been able to raise cattle successfully.

His monthly income is 120 AZN, and this business is the only source of financial income for his family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it every day. Sevindik also keeps dairy cows, for personal use and for selling to neighbors.
 
He applied for a 2000 AZN loan, which he will use to purchase three beef cattle, one milking cow, and fodder. This will be his seventh loan, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase three beef cattle, one milking cow, and fodder

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en: Amarjargal, 49 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a house on fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His sons are married and live separately. He is a good driver and works at a private firm. During his day off, he also transports goods between districts. His daughter is soon going to study in China on scholarship but she can't afford to pay for accommodation, food and other things. So he is requesting a loan of 4,600,000 MNT to help his daughter. He thinks the best thing he can do for his daughter is to contribute to her study.

loans.use: to help his daughter's education

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 32-year-old married woman living with her 3 children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband drives an auto rickshaw; his whole family depends upon him and he has only the single source of income. Now his rickshaw is badly depreciated and needs a healthy amount for immediate repairing. Small maintenance items he can fix through his daily income but this time he is facing extraordinary damages and he does not have enough to fix the problem.

Therefore, Nazia requested a loan for her husband so that her husband could fix the rickshaw. Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repair for an Auto Rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour and paraffin.

loans.name: Fatmata M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school located in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a Kiva  local field partner, to request a loan of SLL 24,500,000. With the help of this loan, each of these teachers will be able to buy or invest in things that with their salaries alone, they cannot buy or invest in. For example, some are going to use this loan to buy a plot of land, some will use it to buy house building materials, some will invest in small scale businesses, others will use it to pay school fees for their children, etc. etc. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries.
