It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Fatmata is the featured leader of this group of teachers. A native of Makeni, the 48-year-old is married to a retired teacher and together the couple has children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatmata has requested a loan of 3,200,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Thoey

texts.en:
Thoey, 56, is married and lives with her husband and six children in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband are farmers who grow pineapple and they supplement their family’s income through selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 15 years, earning about 27,000KHR per day to feed her family. 

Thoey has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her family relieve financial burdens and improve their livelihood. Now she is applying for another loan in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to better her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 35-year-old, married father of one child. He has been working in construction, specializing in painting work, since nineteen years ago. He was only fifteen years old when he started this kind of work. Because he had to help his family in covering their expenses, he had to quit school during his intermediate studies.

Ali is working hard to improve his family’s living, and his painting business isn’t good enough to cover the unexpected needs that have arisen. So he thought of starting a new, extra business, which he believes will provide him with a good income throughout the whole year. His existing painting business is almost seasonal; his high season is during summer, and he barely works during the autumn and winter seasons.

For his next step, Ali is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to open a computer shop, where people can come to play games and to access the Internet, for projects and entertainment. His future plan is to expand his current and newly-established businesses.

loans.use: To start a new business providing Internet access and computer games, to increase his income and improve his family's living

loans.name: Raniel

texts.en:
Raniel is married and has three children. He resides in Commonwealth, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He operates a service business, providing motor transportation in the local community, to make a living.

He borrowed a loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he had joined recently. He will use the loan to purchase a sidecar for the improvement of his transportation business. He plans to have another unit of motorcycle to be used for his business, which will enable him to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a sidecar for his motorcycle

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
El señor Luciano trabaja como albañil, vive en la casa de su cuñado en dos cuartos en acabado de adobe y piso de tierra, en la zona de Bajo Llojeta  de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo  requiere para la compra de material de construccion para dos cuartos con acabado fino y asi ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El sueño de Luciano es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para dejar de vivir en la casa de su cuñado y mejorar el nivel de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
Luciano works as a mason. He lives in the house of his brother-in-law, in two rooms which are lined with adobe and have a dirt floor, in the Bajo Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan to buy construction materials to renovate the two rooms with higher-quality surfaces, thus offering his family a better quality of life. 

Luciano's dream is to save up enough money to move out of his brother-in-law's house and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate two rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shirts and offer greater variety to her customers.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 33 and a hard-working gentleman. He is married to Anne, and a father of four children, aged 10, 7, 4, and 1 year. He worked in the motorcycle transport business for the past three years, making a monthly income of KES 20,000. He learned about KADET from other riders, who are already being funded by KADET.

He has been advanced a third loan of KES 111,943, which will help him to purchase a new motorcycle. The increased proceeds will be used to expand his farming business.

His hope is to educate his children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Hedaya

texts.en:
Hedaya was born in 1983. She is married and a mother of three. Her husband is a tailor. She lives in a rented house with her family, at a sector in Jordan called Wihdat.

Hedaya has been selling clothes for the past seven years. She started her project using a small amount of money to buy clothes. Then she started trading them. She is planning to open her own store, in the future. Now, she wants to buy a larger amount of clothes, in order to raise her profit and income and help her husband to cover their children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this Youth Loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of clothes to sell

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan is 20 years old. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla with her family, which includes four siblings and her parents. Her father is a retired man, and her mother works in agriculture. Rawan is studying for a Bachelor of Computer Information Systems, in her third year. She is planning to get her Bachelor degree, in order to work in her field of study after graduation and start helping her parents financially. But her parents are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay the fees for her upcoming semester. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay the fees for her upcoming semester of study, toward a Bachelor of Computer Information Systems degree

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is 40 years of age, widowed and has six children who attend school, which is the reason for her hard work.  She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Mwenda has operated a cafe business selling such items as rice, tea, beans and chapati (flat bread) to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and food ingredients for her business. Her dream is to see her children get a good education and become important people in society.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and food ingredients for her business

loans.name: Félix Noel

texts.es:
Félix Noel es un joven de 28 años que nació y creció en el municipio de El Sauce, a pesar de ser tan joven tiene su esposa y su hija y se dedica a brindar servicio de Moto Taxi a los pobladores de dicho municipio como sus visitantes.
Este joven ha sido bien luchador digno de admiración porque desde muy chavalo inició a trabajar para ayudar a su madre que es de escasos recursos y que al lado de sus hermanos crecieron sin el apoyo de un padre.
Se siente muy agradecido con Ceprodel porque gracias al primer financiamiento que tuvo compró un tricitaxis con el cual brindaba este servicio y se ganaba el pan de cada día pero al paso de los años con el avance de la tecnología salieron las motos taxis la que adquirió para mejorar su nivel económico.
Félix Noel en este momento necesita del apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le financien un crédito con el cual piensa comprar las llantas de la moto, ya que se aproxima la temporada buena de noviembre y diciembre donde demandan mucho este servicio y necesita tener en buen estado su moto.
Tiene la esperanza que apoyen su solicitud donde quedará eternamente agradecido.
texts.en:
Félix Noel is a 28 year old young man who was born and raised in the town of El Sauce. Despite his youth, he already has a wife and daughter and provides motor taxi services to the inhabitants and visitors in his city.

This young man has been a fighter worthy of admiration because he started working as a kid to help his mother who had few resources. He and his siblings grew up without a father’s support.

He is very grateful to Ceprodel because thanks to the first funding he received he bought a tricycle taxi he used to provide this service and earned his daily bread. However, over the years, technological advances brought motorcycle taxis, and he acquired one in order to improve his standard of living.

At this time, Félix Noel needs support from Kiva investors so that Ceprodel will finance a loan  he will use to purchase tires for his vehicle. The holiday season in November and December is approaching when there is high demand for his services and he needs to have his motorcycle taxi in good condition.

He hopes you will support his request; if so, he will remain eternally gratefully.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en: Lena is 43 years old and supports a family of six people. She has been in business for the past 10 years, with a monthly income of KES 50,000. Lena managed to get her first loan from KADET, in the amount of KES 20,000. She is planning to purchase more stock, with the loan. The anticipated profit she will use to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living standard, and to build her own home.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, aged 42 years, is a married mother of three children. She lives in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Out of her three children, she still has two children dependent on her, and they are still in school. To support her family, Pov has been selling clothes in her village for five years.
 
Pov is just with VisionFund this loan cycle, and now she is applying for a loan. Pov is going to use her loan funds to buy more clothes to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Rositi

texts.en: Rositi is 34 years old and a married mother of six children. To support her family, clothes selling is her only source of income. She has been in business  for several years. This is not her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan to uplift her living conditions. For this loan, she is in need of capital to pay her daughter's tuition fee. She is pursuing her bachelor's degree in economics. Rositi hopes that her daughter can obtain a specific skill so as her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fee

loans.name: Lit's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Lit is a 33-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is in school. She is a rice farmer in her village while her husband is a motor taxi driver. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day from the current businesses and can manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day.
Lit has been with VisionFund for two loans. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s business. She hopes this loan will enable her husband to increase the family’s income and save some costs on maintenance.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband’s business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man. He is an ambitious man who started to work in the construction field in 2009. His job consists of placing pavers. Despite his young age, during these two years Hussein has been able to prove his competence by working efficiently. Today, and to facilitate his work, he is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase construction equipment. As for his future plans, Hussein seeks to be the owner of a proper office where he will make agreements with qualified construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase construction equipment

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida, age 35, is a married, hard-working mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Her husband has a job in a firm and his earnings were so poor that Zahinda started tailoring in her home. She has been doing this work for many years and earns sufficient money to feed her family. She is very expert in her art and knows the techniques of stitching very well. Most of her customers belong to the neighborhood or are her relatives.
To help her continue the operation of her business, she has requested for a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to pay for personal expenses.
Zahida is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her firewood business and earn a higher income.  Besides the firewood business, Fatuma also prepares flat bread and sells to passersby and neighbors.  

Fatuma would like to apply for another loan for KSH 50,000 to purchase sacks of firewood, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: buy firewood, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is 39 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Sophea has been making clay pots for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $4 each day. Her two children work as a garment worker and a construction worker. They earn about $7 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sophea is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase cattle to breed and produce calves to sell. This purchase will help her generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher education degrees. Moreover, she wants to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is 22 years old. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her family, which consists of 7 members. One of her brothers is a driver. 

Alaa is studying in her 3rd year for a Bachelor Degree in Mental Health Guidance. She is planning to get her degree in order to work in her study field after graduation to start helping her parents financially.  Her parents are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them in paying for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Alaa has applied for this loan.

loans.use: pay for her college tuition

loans.name: Qasem

texts.en:
Qasem is 21 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his family, which consists of 7 siblings and his parents. 

Qasem is studying in his 3rd year for a Bachelor in Mental Psychology. His father is a retired man. Qasem is planning to get his Bachelor degree in order to work in his study field after graduation to start helping his parents financially.  

Qasem's parents are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: pay his college tuition

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a widow with two children who are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Nyamvula operates a food making business, making staples like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With this Kshs 50,000, Nyamvula wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver is a 59-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, 4 children, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren in Khelvachauri district. The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, Enver has a cow. His wife milks the cow every day and produces dairy products to sell. In addition, he has a plot of agricultural land where different types of vegetables are grown. 

Enver is a very hard-working man and always has high quality products, which is sold to local retailers. As his existing income is not enough for such a big family, Enver decided to start a new business. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables Enver to get a loan of $5000 for starting his business.   With the loan, he will rent a commercial space and purchase stocks of groceries to open a grocery store. He will have a chance to be involved in his own business and increase the income for his family.

loans.use: open a grocery store

loans.name: Kimsorn's Group

texts.en:
Kimsorn  is a local resident from Battambang province. She is 33 years old and blessed with three schoolchildren. To earn a decent income to support her living, Kimsorn sells vegetables and fruit as the main source of income.  It is the business that she has had for 8 years.  

This is Kimsorn's fourth-time loan with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loans wisely and upgraded her living gradually to afford to provide for the daily food for her children. Now, she is the leader of a loan group of two. 

Kimsorn and her co-borrower are seeking for the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. For Kimsorn, she will spend her loan portion to buy more vegetables and fruit for resale. She hopes that she can replenish her business on time and make more income.

loans.use: buy vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van, age 54, is a married mother of seven children. Nowadays, only four of her children are in school. 

To deal with the daily food consumption, Van does rice farming and raises cows as the family’s core business. Besides the income from the agribusiness, she also get another source of income from her husband who is working as a village chief. 

Van has been involved in her current business for 35 years, earning about 35,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Van is in her sixth cycle loan, whereas her joint borrower is in her fourth cycle loan. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled Van to upgrade her lifestyle progressively and keep her kids in school. 

For this new cycle, Van is seeking 600,000 KHR while her co-member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seeds and mango and jackfruit seedlings to grow for additional income.  She hopes that she can gain a good income from her business so that she can expand her business larger than before.

loans.use: buy rice seeds and mango and jackfruit seedings

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a 47-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of 6 children.  Her husband provides white wash and oil paint services to his customers in the community.  Sometimes he has to go out of the city also.   He sits on the front of a paint dealer shop so that he can easily find new customers but sometimes he does not find any customer. 

Irshad's husband got a new contract to white wash and oil paint a newly constructed house, but he has no paint brush or roller for white washing. Irshad requested this loan so that her husband would be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, paint, kerosene oil, etc.  Her husband’s savings are very poor, that is why he is unable to buy new tools for providing white wash services. 

Irshad wants to change this condition for her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband.  She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy paint tools and supplies

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Kristina, with her three goats and a baby one, in their little stable. Kristina wants to add some more goats with this loan, and to accomplish this, she needs your financial help.

She was widowed long ago and has five school-aged children to raise, all on her own. They live in the northeastern part of the country. She and her children have been living very poorly. She was never given the opportunity to apply for a loan, since she fell below the national poverty line. Kristina is very appreciative to Kiva, and VFA also, for this great opportunity. The startup loan through VFA is 4.5% lower interest compared to other credit products, so she considers this as a “Godsend."

loans.use: to add more goats

loans.name: Orlando Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Orlando Rafael  vive en Managua trabaja desde hace 24 años en una institución del estado   se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable en su trabajo y con su familia.
Orlando hace una solicitud de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, bloque, cemento, hierro para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación ya que con esto va a mejorar las condiciones y comodidades de su familia.
A la vez nos manifiesta que se siente muy agradecido porque gracias a los crédito que le han financiado ha mejorados  poco a poco su casa para darle mayor seguridad a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Orlando Rafael lives in Managua. He has worked in a government agency for the past 24 years. He is distinguished as being a responsible person to both his work and his family. Orlando is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cinder blocks, cement and re-bar. He will build a room which will improve the living conditions and comfort of his family. At the same time he told us that he is very grateful as thanks to the loans which he has been given, he has been able to improve his house little by little to make his loved ones more secure.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Savuth's Group

texts.en:
Savuth is 43 years old and married with four children. He and his family live in a village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice and planting cassava for 23 years, earning about 24,000 KHR per day. 

Savuth is in his sixth loan cycle with Kiva's partner VisionFund, while his member is in her fifth cycle. Savuth has successfully used the past loans to improve his family’s livelihood. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. He will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to grow better crops and produce higher yields in order to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Emm's Group

texts.en:
Emm, 31 years old, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband in a rural village of the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. 

Emm and her husband earn a living by farming rice and by working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about USD 11 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Emm has been with VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles. The past loans, which she successfully paid, have helped her family to support their business and improve their living conditions. 

Now leading this group to apply for a loan, Emm, who is the leader, will use half of her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and half to pay for water pumping. She hopes to increase her family’s income to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and to pay for water pumping.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: José Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor José Ignacio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en un centro de compra de la capital en el área de ordenamiento de los comerciantes.
José está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de láminas de zinc y madera para hacerle en cambio de techo a su vivienda que está en mal estado y con el invierno cuando llueve  se le pasa el agua.
Agradeciendo mucho a kiva y ceprodel  por esta oportunidad que le está ofreciendo para mejorar su casa de habitación  y darles un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor José Ignacio lives in Managua and works in the retail purchasing department of a shopping center in the city. 

He is applying for a loan and plans to invest the funds in the purchase of zinc sheets and wood to install a new roof on his house. The existing roof is in poor condition and leaks during the winter rains. 

Señor José Ignacio is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for offering him this opportunity to improve his home and provide a proper roof for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong, 63 years old, has been a hard-working and determined farmer for many years. She is a widower and a mother of four adult children: two married children and two single children. They currently live together in a house in Kampong Rolea B’lier district of Kampong Chhnang province. Some of her children give her a helping hand in her farming business and the others work in various jobs and businesses in order to help cover the costs of living and to improve their living standards.

With the loan amount Suong has requested from Kiva lenders, she aims to support her son’s business of repairing phones. The loan will be used to buy spare phone parts and phone accessories for her son's repair shop. She hopes that, through the loan's help, her son will be able to go ahead in his business and make his business more viable and profitable in the future. 

Suong thanks lenders for this constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy spare phone parts and phone accessories for her son's repair shop.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 34-year-old, married father of three children who works as mechanic, specializing in Volkswagen cars. Fouad provides the only financial support for his family. He is a hard-worker, with 19 years of experience.

Fouad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to build a room, specialized for his mechanic's work, to expand his working area before the winter season arrives.

Fouad also has future plans. He wants to buy all the necessary equipment needed for developing his work.

loans.use: to build a room, specialized for his mechanic's work, to expand his working area before the winter season arrives.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 30 years old, widowed, with three children, two of whom she is supporting.

Margaret has been in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru for nine years and she has applied for her first loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), to enable her to buy potatoes and cabbages, among other vegetables to sell. With the anticipated profits, Margaret plans to buy a land.

In the near future, she hopes to expand her farming business to uplift her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and cabbages, among other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Massaran

texts.fr:
Née en  janvier 1976 à KANGARE, MASSARAN y vit avec son enfant et son époux dans une  famille monogame (3 eme région administrative du Mali) 
MASSARAN n’a pas eut la chance d aller a l école,  très vite s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de l’encens,  de  pagnes, bazin et produits de beauté.  Après avoir correctement remboursé les prêts précédents, MASSARAN est à son cinquième   prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité  importante d’encens et de produit beauté  et  30 pièces de bazin auprès des  grossistes a BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail dans sa boutique à KANGARE à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
MASSARAN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Massaran was born in January 1976 in Kangare, which is in the 3rd largest administrative region in Mali. She lives there in a monogamous relationship with her husband, with whom she has one child.

Massaran didn’t have the opportunity to go to school. She quickly became interested in moneymaking businesses, particularly buying and selling incense, pagne [a traditional cloth], damask and beauty products. This will be Massaran’s fifth loan through Soro Yiriwaso, after having repaid her previous loans on schedule. She will use the funds to buy large quantities of incense and beauty products, as well as 30 lengths of damask from the wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her products to male and female customers for cash or on credit from her retail store in Kangare. 

Massaran hopes to make 100,000 Francs CFA a month, which she will use to help her husband meet the needs of their family, to repay her loan and to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy sundry items.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Susan. She is married and has three children, ages 25, 20, and 18 years. She has two nieces who live with her and she takes care of them. 

In 2009, Susan established her provision and drinks business. She began her business to earn a living. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, Susan met her target of increasing her monthly profits by SLL 500,000.  She earns about SLL 1,500,000 (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

Susan would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires the loan in order to buy provisions worth SLL 3,000,000. 

She was able to expand her business by getting involved in the wholesaling of soft drinks and she employed a sales assistant. 

Susan is planning to buy 50 crates of empties and to buy more soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions and soft drinks.

loans.name: Samad

texts.en:
Samad  is 47 years old. He has three children. 

Samad is a market vendor and he sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in his place, in a central bazaar and from his home. Samad has ten years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 

He chose this business because it is profitable and it brings stable income. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and also make fresh punch. Samad's monthly income is AZN 120.

Samad applied for an AZN 2,000 loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables and to increase his monthly turnover. This will be his fourth loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables and to increase his monthly turnover.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 43 years old. She lives with her 6 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a motorcycle mechanic by profession. He repairs and troubleshoots the motorbikes. He provides the services nearby to his hometown. Most people of his hometown who have bikes have him do repairs. 

Naseem's husband has been running this business for many years and uses very expensive tools for repairing. His tools are wearing out so he wants to replace these tools with new ones. He does not have money to buy new tools. Therefore, Naseem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for repairing motorcycles.
 
Naseem says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy repairing tools and some spare parts for motorcycle repairing shop.

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
Don José Elías es un señor de 65 años, casado que habita en la comunidad de Salales ubicado a 20 kilómetros del municipio de El Sauce.
Vive al lado de su esposa donde juntos trabajan para tener el pan de cada día. Su negocio consiste en brindar servicio de Molino a los pobladores de dicho caserío.
El Molino es una máquina que se utiliza para moler maíz con el cual se elaboran las tortillas que es el bastimento principal en Nicaragua y granos para elaborar refrescos.
Este señor cuenta con dos Molinos uno eléctrico que es atendido por su esposa y el otro a base de combustible que es atendido por él.
Don José Elías en este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para comprar un motor para reparar uno de sus molinos, ya que es demasiado caro y no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para hacerle frente a este gasto.
Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva apoyen su solicitud a través de Ceprodel para poder llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
José Elías is a 65-year old married man who lives in the community of Salales, located 20km away from the municipality of El Sauce. He lives with his wife and they both work to get ahead. They provide mill services to the inhabitants of the community. A mill is a machine used to grind the corn, which is later used to make tortillas (main supply in Nicaragua), as well as grains to make refreshments. He has two mills: one of them is electric and managed by his wife; and the other one uses fuel and is managed by him. 

José Elías is currently requesting a loan to buy an engine for one of his mills. It is too expensive and he does not have enough money to cover the cost. He trusts in God and believes that Kiva lenders will support him through Ceprodel and that he will be able to make the investment.

loans.use: to buy an engine to repair a mill.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim is 49 years old. She is widowed and resides with her son in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish and vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her son is a garment worker who makes an income of $4 daily. To improve her family’s finances, Kim is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase fish, vegetables and fruits to resell. This money will help her expand the business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to raise pigs to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase fish, as well as vegetables and fruit, to resell

loans.name: Nancy De Las Mercedes

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó trabajando 15 años en una peluquería, después de 2 años su jefe se fue de viaje y le vendió su negocio, el cual lo pudo montar en su propia casa.  Trabaja sola de 9 am a 9 pm, todos los días.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como taxista particular.  Tiene un hijo de 16 años, quien estudia en el colegio fiscal de su barrio.  Desea a futuro poder elaborar el piso de su casa y ampliar su gabinete.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de tintes, esmaltes, una secadora y una plancha de cabello.
texts.en:
The client is from the Orquídes sector of Guayaquil.  She started working 15 years ago in a hairdresser’s shop.  After two years her boss went on a trip and sold her the business.  She was able to set this business up at her own house.  She works alone from 9 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day.

She is married and her husband works as a private taxi driver.  She has a 16 year old son who goes to the neighborhood public school.

In the future she wishes to be able to work on the floor of her house and expand her beauty shop.

She now needs the loan to buy dyes, nail polish, a dryer, and a hair iron.

loans.use: to buy supplies and items to use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sorbeh Group Ii

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Sorbeh Group. The members are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 2,500,000 in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mariatu is the featured leader of this group. She is 32 years old. She is married with three children, two of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Mariatu sells fish and has been in this this business for 10 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Jaider

texts.es: Jaider  habita en el municipio de Soledad, donde desarrolla una actividad comercial combinada: por un lado vende productos de miscelánea, como artículos femeninos, para el hogar, accesorios etc. y por otro lado vende en el mismo local productos de ferretería. Su negocio inició desde hace 10 años; él deriva esta actividad de la tradición de comerciante de sus padres, que lo influenciaron   desde muy joven y por eso a una corta edad se dedicó a la venta de artículos varios. En su negocio inició con accesorios domésticos, femeninos etc y posteriormente fue agregando mercancía de ferretería, como crema para soldar, soldadura, tornillos, clavos, cemento, cintas aislantes. Sus ventas las realiza de contado, de lunes a domingos, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, mientras sus compras las hace de contado en almacenes mayoristas, que le ofrecen precios ajustados a las posibilidades de compra de su clientela, quienes son vecinos de su barrio y especialmente de varios sectores alrededor de su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vitrinas, tuercas, tornillos, herramientas etc. Su meta mas adelante es dar apertura a un nuevo local, para generar más recursos y finalmente ofrecerles una educación de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jaider lives in the Soledad municipality, which is where he carries out his combined business activities.  On one side he sells miscellaneous products like women’s items for the household and accessories, etc.  On the other side of the same place he sells hardware products.

He started his business ten years ago.  He gets this business activity from his parents’ commercial tradition, which influenced him ever since he was very young.  At a young age he devoted himself to selling various items.  He started his business with domestic accessories and women’s accessories, etc.  Later he was adding hardware merchandise like soldering cream, welding pieces, screws, nails, cement, and insulation strips.

He makes his sales for cash on Mondays through Sundays from nine in the morning until nine at night.  He makes his purchases for cash at wholesale warehouses that offer prices that are adjusted for sales to his customers.  His customers are his neighbors in his neighborhood and especially from the various sectors surrounding his business.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy display cases, nuts, screws, and tools, etc.  His goal for later on is to open a new place in order to generate more resources and to provide his children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy display cases, nuts, screws, and tools, etc.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 19-year-old single man who has had a mobile-phone shop since January 2013. He also sells mobile accessories and provides maintenance to his customers. His financial situation isn’t good enough to expand and develop his business easily. Thus, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy newly released mobile phones, which are highly requested by customers.

Mohamad hopes that in the future he’ll be capable of expanding his business easily.

loans.use: to buy newly released mobile phones, which are highly requested by customers

loans.name: Sommie Roxana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de lenceria como ropas interiores y medias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,le sueño de la socia es tener un tienda donde pueda vender la lenceria.La socia solicita le credito para comprar medias y ropas interiores.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member continues to work selling lingerie, such as underwear and tights. She works from 8am to 6pm and has several years of experience in the business. Things are going well and her dream is to have a store to sell lingerie. 

The member is requesting a loan to buy tights and underwear. She is grateful to those that support her and are part of her dream, and commits to repaying as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy tights and underwear.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is a 28-year-old single mother living with her 4-year-old daughter and her parents. She is separated from her husband due to some personal reasons. 

She does not want to become a burden on her father, so she started a business of making beedis (Indian cigarettes filled with tobacco flakes and wrapped in tendu leaves). Her job is to roll the tendu leaves into a cigarette shape and fill them with tobacco flakes. She spends seven to eight hours per day making six bundles of beedis (each bundle contains 25 beedis) and sells them directly to the retailer. From this business, she earns 3,500 INR (Indian rupees) per month. 

Sunita has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing raw materials like tobacco and tendu leaves. She wants to save some money to send her daughter to a good school and see her daughter become independent.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like tobacco and tendu leaves for making beedis (Indian cigarettes filled with tobacco flakes and wrapped in tendu leaves).

loans.name: Hamudy

texts.es: Hamudy  de 35 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Soledad, donde hace 10 años se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado. Cuando muy joven, viendo a sus compañeros de universidad vender artículos y ganar dinero, decidió realizar esa misma actividad, pues lo vio muy fácil en la medida en que no requería mucho capital de trabajo. Hoy Hamudy vende a crédito y de contado y se dedica  a esta actividad, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Su principal mercado se encuentra entre los empleados de empresas en el departamento de la Guajira. Su meta mas adelante es abrir una cadena de puntos comerciales, establecerse y formar su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestidos femeninos y masculinos y también calzado. Su inversión tendrá éxito porque la está haciendo sobre pedidos y previo a las temporadas más comerciales del año, como son las navidades y el año nuevo.
texts.en:
Hamudy is 35 and lives in the town of Soledad, where he has for ten years sold clothing and shoes. 

When he was a young man, Hamudy saw his university classmates selling merchandise and earning money. He decided to go into this business himself as it didn't require much working capital. Today Hamudy works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., selling clothing and shoes for cash and on credit. His customers are mainly employees of businesses in Guajira Department.   

Hamudy's goal for the future is to open a chain of retail stores and set up his own household. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first application to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Hamudy plans to use the loan funds to purchase men's and women's clothing and shoes, an investment that will be profitable. Hamudy has already received orders and the Christmas and New Year's holidays, the busiest season of the year, are approaching.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Gouranga

texts.en:
Gournga is a 52-year-old person living with his parents and wife. He is running a grocery shop and earns only 3,000 INR (Indian rupees) per month from this business. That is very low for his family's monthly expenses.

His father is ill and is about 80 years old. Gournga is the only person in the family who is earning. He is a very hardworking and optimistic person. He wants to expand his business so that he can earn more money; for that he needs financial help.

He requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR to purchase oil, sugar, biscuits, etc. for his grocery shop. He wants to earn more money for his family and for his father’s treatment.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, biscuits, etc. for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Deus Anderson

texts.es: Deus está muy satisfecho con su anterior credikiva, pues con él logró atraer muchos mas clientes, porque creo su propia publicidad, invirtió en nuevos artículos y amplió sus ruteros de clientes y cubrió sus pedidos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará mercancía para el hogar, juegos de sabanas y vajillas. Deus tiene planeado ganar mucho mas en esta temporada, donde usualmente se incrementar sus ventas, por eso  su credikiva será exitoso. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por la oportunidad de ayudarme como microempresario, fue muy fructífera la ayuda recibida. “
texts.en:
Deus is very pleased with his previous Kiva loan as it allowed him to attract many more customers. Deus used the loan funds to purchase new merchandise, advertise his business himself, expand his sales area, and fill his orders. 

Deus is currently applying for a new loan that he will use to purchase household goods, sheets, and silverware. His sales typically rise at the end of the year, so Deus plans to earn much more money this season and make a success of this Kiva loan. 

Deus would like to send the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the opportunity to help myself as a small businessman, the help I've received was extremely valuable."

loans.use: comprará mercancía para el hogar, juegos de sabanas y vajillas

loans.name: Roxi Jimara

texts.es:
Roxi de 32 años de edad, es una persona muy carismática y alegre. Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años tiene una pulpería en Puerto Cabezas, inicio sus primeras inversiones con créditos de grupos solidarios que le ha brindado Pana Pana y desde hace dos años ha recibido dos préstamos en la modalidad de crédito individual. 

Actualmente solicita un nuevo préstamo, para ampliar su pulpería, surtirla de granos básicos, tales como: Frijoles, arroz, azúcar, etc.

Por medio de los ingresos que percibe en su negocio ha mejorado su calidad de vida, lo cual le ha permitido realizarle mejoras y reparaciones a su vivienda.

Uno de sus principales sueños es ampliar su negocio, establecer una comideria y tortillería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roxi, 32, is a very cheerful and charismatic person.  She's had a grocery store in Puerto Cabezas for about 10 years.  She made her first investments with communal bank loans she got from Pana Pana and for the last two years has been getting individual loans.  

She's currently asking for a new loan to expand the grocery store and to stock it with basic grains like beans, rice, sugar, etc.  Income earned from her business has improved her quality of life and she's been able to make improvements and repairs to her home.  

One of her main dreams is to expand the business and opening an cafe and tortilla shop at home.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en: Ketevan is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two children and parents-in-law in Batumi district. Her husband serves local people as a taxi driver and generates income. Ketevan is unemployed now. She worked as a cosmetologist and is experienced in this field. She decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $350 to purchase equipment and work as a cosmetologist from home.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic equipment

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer  trabajadora y dinámica, está casada con  Julián quien es empleado y  padre  de sus 02 hijos. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. Cruz se dedica a la producción y venta de helados de frutas de la selva, el cual lo elabora en su hogar contando con materiales adecuados para la elaboración de estos productos, y los vende en la puerta del colegio al medio día, logrando ganarse muchos  clientes por su buena atención. Lleva 08 años en está actividad, el cual lo realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera, y poder apoyar a su familia con los gastos  de su hogar, también le gusta el tiempo libre que tiene y el poder usarlo en otras actividades. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevo soles, comprará frutas de toda variedad y calidad, buscando aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías disponible para la venta y así tener más acogida e ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Cruz, 55, is a dynamic and hard-working woman. She is married to Julián who has a job and is the father of their two children. Together, they live comfortably in their own home. Cruz works in the production and sales of ice cream made with jungle fruit. She makes the ice cream in her home with the ingredients necessary for these products. She sells them at the school entrance at lunchtime. She gains a lot of customers due to her good service. She has eight years experience in this job, which she started with her children's help. She likes the income she earns from her job so she can support her family by paying household expenses. She also likes the free time she has to do other activities.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit so she can advance her business. For this reason, she promises to make her payments punctually. With the requested amount of 1,500 nuevo soles, she will buy a variety of quality fruits to increase her stock of available merchandise for sale. Then she will have more in stock and more income.

loans.use: to buy regional fruits to make ice cream.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Residing in Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province, Mao is 50 years old and has five children. For the rest of his family, he can earn a decent income from three hectares of rice farming, from which he can generate about 34,300 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Mao with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully repaid his first loan smartly to support his business promptly. 

For this cycle, he wants to pay attention to his son, who is eager to hold a bachelor’s degree, specializing in biology. Therefore, Mao applied for an education loan to pay for his son’s tuition fee. He hopes that his son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Kimsreang's Group

texts.en:
Kimsreang is aged 31 years old and married. She lives with her husband and five children in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. All of her children are still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers, and they supplement their income by working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 11 years, together they can earn about KHR 16,000 per day.

Kimsreang is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the loan, which has helped her improve her family’s living condition. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and will use a portion of it on labor fees. She hopes to grow her business and make more crops to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Momaqua Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Momaqua” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently, improve on their living conditions.
 . 
Doris is the featured leader of this group of teachers. A native of Kiama, Doris is 28 years old. She is married to a miner, and together they have three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Doris has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells market food – palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. 

With the help of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, Margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Casto

texts.es: El Sr. Casto sigue con la misma actividad de la construcción y remodelación de viviendas,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para realizar su trabajo, Cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en compra de una motocicleta para ayudar a transportarse a sus distintos trabajos
texts.en: Sr. Casto continues with his construction business of building and remodeling houses.  On this occasion, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy tools that he needs to perform his work.  He did very well with his previous loan since he used the money to buy a motorcycle, which helped him to travel to his various jobs.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is at the age of 35. She is the mother of five daughters and three sons. Her two sons stay free at home and one of them is studying until now. 
Her husband is a greengrocer by profession, and sells fresh vegetables over at a shop nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. 

He has been feeding his children and old parents from the generated income from the vegetable shop. Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased, and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize his vegetable sales.

Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetable than previous.
Razia says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural is 33 years old. He is married and has three children. 

He is a market vendor and sells different types of food items. The most popular items he sells include candies, sausages, macaroni, tinned food, and juices.  Tural has three years of experience selling food items, and during this time he has acquired the necessary skills to be successful. His monthly income is AZN 200. His brother helps him to sell in the shop.

Tural would like to diversify his product offerings and purchase more merchandise. This will help him increase sales and improve his family’s living conditions. In order to do this, he needs additional capital, so he has applied for a loan of AZN 1,800. 

This will be Tural's fourth loan, and he has perfect credit history.

loans.use: to diversify his product offerings and purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Dalale

texts.en:
Dalale is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children, who attend school. 

Dalale has worked as a beautician for the past thirteen years. Over time, she was able to gain a lot of experience and open her own institute. Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase beauty products and supplies. She will use the loan to buy a laser and a tattoo machine. 

Dalale is well known for her excellent services. She is certain that with new laser services, she will be able to attract more customers and thus augment her revenue. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further expand her business by opening a bigger salon.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and supplies

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny is a widowed mother of five children residing in Pursat province. She has one and a half hectare area of rice farming to cover her daily cost of living. This is the business that she has had for 33 years, earning about 30,700 KHR per day.

Never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Ny teamed up a group of three to get a new loan. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each, while a remaining member is applying for 500,000 KHR. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops and grocery items for resale to earn additional income. She hopes that her business will succeed and improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops and grocery items for resale to earn additional income.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima is a 42-year-old, married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and six children. She owns a bakery where she produces pastries and bread, which she bakes during the early morning, and sells out steaming hot to commuters, students, and workers. 

She has occupied this business since 2007. Today, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase new baking supplies and raw materials. 

Bassima’s only aim is to increase her productivity, and hence her income to well support the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase new baking supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 20-year-old single man who has worked as a barber since 2008. Although Ayman has short experience in the field, he has proved to be very skilled.

 His business income isn’t enough for him to make the necessary maintenance and decoration to his shop.  That’s why he is applying for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

Through this loan, Ayman will put an internal covering for the ceiling so as to cover all the unattractive things from appearing to customers, in addition to pasting the floor tiles with several decoration ideas he would like to do. 

He hopes to keep on expanding and developing his business to attract more customers.

loans.use: to maintain and decorate his barber shop

loans.name: Jackelin Sindy

texts.es:
Jackelin estudia  Ingeniería Alimentaria en una Universidad local
Jackelin continúa con sus estudios y lo hace satisfactoriamente, actualmente trabaja como asistente de calidad en alimentos, se siente feliz porque este trabajo le permite desarrollar sus conocimientos y adquirir experiencia. Jackelin ha solicitado este segundo crédito para el pago de sus pensiones y así continuar con sus estudios,este préstamo le permite estudiar con tranquilidad esta agradecida a los inversionistas de KIVA porque ellos hacen  posible que muchos jóvenes como ella se conviertan en profesionales y logren sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jackelin is studying Food Science at a local university. 

Jackelin is continuing with her studies and is doing it in a satisfactory manner. She is currently working as a food quality control assistant. She feels happy because this work allows her to develop her knowledge and gain experience. Jackelin has applied for this second loan in order to pay her fees and thus continue with her studies. This loan will allow her to study with peace of mind. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because they make it possible for many young people like her to become professionals and achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is forty-five years old and supports a family of three. She has been in the business of selling cereal for the last ten years. She is able to earn a monthly income of Ksh 50,000.

Jane has qualified for a loan from KADET LTD in the amount Ksh 20,000. She plans to use the funds to purchase more stock. She will use the profit to expand her business. She hopes and dreams of improving her living standards and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cereal

loans.name: Sudabe

texts.en:
Sudabe is a 41-year-old woman; a widow who raises her two children alone. She is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods like shampoo, flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. She has 10 years of experience and deep knowledge of the market and the demands of her clients. Since her husband’s death, she has been receiving social financial support, but it is too low to cover her family's demands.

The food products Sudabe sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling the food is 200 AZN. Her sons help her purchase the products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income for her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location, in the central bazaar of her home city.

She applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover her customers` demands.

loans.use: to purchase more food products.

loans.name: Souy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Souy is 43 years old and married with six children, two of whom are dependent and still in school.

The main source of her family income is rice farming. She has been in this business for almost fifteen years. With the current business, she can earn about 48,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Souy. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Souy will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her crop yield and sell it for a good price to fulfill her dream of expanding her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Orxan

texts.en:
Orxan is 27 years old. He is not married and lives in his own house with his parents. He operates a store where he sells food products, including cakes, rice, and sugar. His store is run out of his house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. He kindly tends to his customers. 

Orxan has been in this business for five years. He started the business with his own capital due to the need to have an occupation and support his life partner with the household expenses. After seeing the profits that his sales generated, he decided to continue his business. Also, the business makes him feel like a productive and independent person. He wants to see his business grow and wants to improve his parent's well-being.

Orxan is requesting 1900 Azn to buy food products, such as cakes, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store. He is grateful for the opportunity to access a loan, which will allow him to continue meeting his goals. He pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client. He has a good loan history. This is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Elburus

texts.en:
Elburus is 34 years old and married, with four kids. 

Elburus raises fruits and vegetables in his garden, and he has been doing this for the past eight years.  He is a very experienced farmer and has a deep knowledge of the land and how to work it. 

Elburus usually grows seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people like to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also one of the favorite national dishes, dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers, and tomatoes.  

Elburus's monthly income from this business is AZN 120. This is the only source of income in his family.

Now he would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizer. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of AZN 2,000. He hopes this loan will improve life for his family.

loans.use: to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en: Em is 52 years old and married. She is blessed with five children. She grows pineapple for resale to earn enoiugh to cover the basic needs of her household. Engaging in current business for ten years, she is able to earn up to 23,000 KHR per day.  This is the first-microloan for Em with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Joining a group of four, she is a leader. Em will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her pineapple plantation. She hopes that she can boost her yield on time and double her income to improve her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her pineapple plantation

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Kutaisi district with her two children. Her children go to the local school. Marine is unemployed now and decided to request a loan to start her own business.

The Start Up loan, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $800 to start a new business. She will purchase meat-chopper and raw material to make Georgian "Khinkali" to sell.

She will get orders and work from home. This new business initiative will help her generate income and improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to purchase meat-chopper and raw material to make Georgian "Khinkali" to sell.

loans.name: Nora Elizeth

texts.es: Nora, tiene 25 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en unión libre con su esposo en el municipio de Quimistan, Santa Barbara. Ella tiene 2 años de tener un negocio de una pulpería donde ofrece productos alimenticios como ser carnes, arroz, maíz, frijoles, lácteos, refrescos, verduras, churros, pan etc. El prestamo que ha solicitado es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos como ser refrescos, carnes, huevos, pan, manteca y granos básicos y asi poder tener más surtido el negocio y obtener más ganancias. También va comprar madera para poner las ventanas a su casa. Su plan es tener una casa más grande, ayudarles a sus hijos con la educación y tener siempre con mucho producto el negocio.
texts.en:
Nora is 25 years old. She has two children and lives with her common-law husband in the municipality of Quimistan, Santa Barbara. For the past two years she has been operating a small store that offers food products such as meat, rice, corn, beans, dairy products, soft drinks, vegetables, churros (a fried dough pastry), bread, etc. 

The loan Nora is requesting is for 20,000 HNL. She will use it to buy more products like soft drinks, meat, eggs, bread, lard and basic grains. She can stock her store more and generate more income. Also she will buy wood to install windows in her house. Her plan is to have a larger house, help her children with their education and keep her store well-stocked.

loans.use: to stock her business with products like soft drinks, meat, basic grains, lard, bread, eggs,etc. and also use part of the loan to buy wood to install windows in her house.

loans.name: Soltanxanim

texts.en:
Soltanxanim is a 49-year-old mother of two kids. When she was 30, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents were the ones who taught her to grow fruits and vegetables since it was their only source of income. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years now. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support her family.

Soltanxanim’s income from her business is 150 AZN. In order to enhance the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes that in the near future, her sons will help her expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruits business is a profitable and fun business, she wants it to continue and prosper.

Soltanxanim needs a 1,800 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees. Her biggest wish is to offer her children an education so that they can have good careers and help their family. This is her third loan and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.fr: Fidèle est une femme de 52 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 25 ans, deux de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail du bois de chauffage  en dans un marché de la place depuis 08 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter un pick-up des bois de chauffage pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fidèle is 52 years old, married, and has 4 children between the ages of 12 and 25. Two of her children are still in school. 

She is a merchant, and for eight years, she has been selling firewood to retail customers at a local market. She knows her suppliers well, and her clients especially well. She has acquired her clients over time through her experience in the field.

She constantly faces stock shortages, and due to limited capital, she has to sell all of her stock in order to buy more supplies. 

She would like to buy a pickup load of firewood so that she can have enough stock to meet meet the needs of her clients and prevent stock shortages.

She will save her income not only to grow her business, but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: Increase her stock of firewood.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He has been working as a fisherman for over 10 years. He works on his dad’s fishing boat, and buys frequently needed tools from a local fishing center to proceed with his business operation properly. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to buy fishing equipment and tackles. Hussein is very ambitious and feels positive about his business prospects for the upcoming year. He looks forward to owning a fishing boat as soon as he can.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and tackles.

loans.name: Luri

texts.es: Luri, de 46 años de edad, esta casada con Arístides, sus hijos ya son independientes. Vive su casa propia junto  a su pareja. La actividad que realiza Luri es la venta de carne de res para eso cuenta con un puesto instalado en el mercado principal de su localidad donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. Se inició hace 10 años con un capital propio viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio, al principio tuvo la ayuda económica de su pareja. Poco a poco su capital inicial se fue multiplicando y  aumentaba la cantidad de carne que vendía, Al principio trabajaba y atendía sola, pero ahora lo hace con ayuda de su esposo. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite interactuar con las personas, del mismo modo los ingresos económicos que obtiene le ayudan a colaborar con los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es que algunos de sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras a lo que se niega pues ya tuvo malas experiencias con este tipo de ventas. Tienen planes de implementar su negocio y así seguir creciendo generándose  más ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente contenta de contar con el apoyo financiero necesario para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, comprará una sierra de corte para carne con  el fin de mejorar la calidad de los productos que ofrece, además comprará carne para que continúe sus ventas.
texts.en: Luri is 46 years old and is married to Arístides. Her children are already independent and she lives in her own house with her husband. Luri works selling beef in a stall in the main market of her town and she takes care of her clients in a very friendly way. She started her business 10 years ago investing her own capital because she needed to generate her own income. Her husband helped her economically in the beginning. Little by little her income started to grow  and the quality of the meat she was selling improved. Initially, she took care of her clients alone but now her husband helps her too. She enjoys her business because it allows her to interact with people and because it makes it possible for her to contribute with the household expenses. However, she is not comfortable with some of her clients asking for loans for their purchases and, because she had problems with that in the past, she doesn't accept that kind of payment anymore. Her objective is to supply her business and continue to grow and generate more income. This is the second loan she requests to Kiva. She is very happy to have the economic support she needs to move forward and she promises to pay her fees punctually. With the requested amount of 3000 nuevos soles, she will buy a meat-cutting serrated knife to improve the quality of the products she sells. In addition, she will buy more meat in order to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy a work tool and wholesale meat

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio es un señor casado de 48 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos  hijos y esposa en el Municipio de Santo Tomas La Unión.
El es un hombre trabajador que desea sacar adelante a su familia. Comenta que se dedica a la compraventa de banano en el mercado local de su comunidad. Actualmente lleva 23 años en esta labor que su padre le enseño, desde que el era pequeño.
El ahora ha observado que su negocio es bastante rentable, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para la compra de banano por mayor y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es generar más ganancias a través de su negocio y así poder comprar un terreno en donde pueda cosechar sus bananos.
texts.en:
Ignacio, 48, is married and lives with his wife and their two children in the town of Santo Tomas La Unión.

He is a hard-working man who wants to move his family forward. He says that he makes a living by buying and selling banana plants from the local market in his community. He has 23 years experience with this work, which his father taught him since he was a child.

He has now noticed that his business is fairly profitable. For this reason, he's decided to request a loan of 7,000 Q to buy banana plants wholesale to increase his income.

His biggest dream is to earn more income through his business so he can buy land where he can plant his banana trees.

loans.use: to buy wholesale banana pants.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. In 2012, he was able to open a communications shop where he sells mobile phones, related accessories, women's bags, and gadgets. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase cellular phones and prepaid cards in addition to doing some renovation work that he plans to do on his store. The majority of mobile phone users in Lebanon purchase the prepaid cards; that’s the reason why Hussein seeks to acquire these purchases so as to be able to increase his sales by a large percentage.  

This is his first Kiva loan and he is very optimistic about what he will attain monetarily after getting it. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase its capital.

loans.use: to purchase cellular phones and prepaid telephone cards in addition to some renovation work

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy lives in the Kilifi area, a few kilometers north of Mombasa, Kenya.  He is 56 years old and married with two children. He supplies eggs and sweets to the local retail businesses. He has been doing this business for more than five years and the business is doing great. He also deals in charcoal sales. He knew of Milango through friends and he joined so that he would save and be able to access funding for his business. He now seeks a loan to buy sweets and eggs to supply to the local traders. The changes in prices and inflation have been a major challenge for him. He hopes that the prices will stabilize and the business will grow. The extra income that he will raise will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy sweets and eggs

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He has operated a bakery since 2001 where he produces pastries and bread. His store is adjacent to his house and his regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. Today, Mohamad needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter required to continue production in addition to a special baking machine. Through this opportunity, he will be able to increase sales and progressively will grow to become a very brave and efficient businessman at his location.

loans.use: to buy raw supplies and special baking machinery

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is age 39, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a milkman by profession; most of his relatives are doing the same business. He sells milk in the market and in this market most of the retailers are his relatives. Due to competition he has moved his milk shop to another place so that he could get the maximum profit for his family. Due to shifting to a new place he does not have money left to buy milk from the wholesaler.

Therefore, Abida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy milk to sell. 
Abida is very happy after taking this loan and says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh milk to sell.

loans.name: Jose Joel

texts.es: Don José, tiene 61 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Trinidad, Santa Barbara. José siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, anteriormente tenia una pulpería.
