Hace 3 años que tiene el negocio de venta de carne de pollo por libras y  por mayor. también tiene un  taller de elaboración o reparación de tenis, chinelas, tacos, zapatos escolares de niña y niño etc. El prestamo que solicito es el tercer ciclo el cual es por 15,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de carne de pollo y embutidos para vender y materia prima para la elaboración de calzado como cuero, suela, pegamento, etc. Su objetivo es mejorar eficazmente en los dos negocios, mejorar cada día la relación con su familia.
texts.en: José is a 61-year-old married man with two children who lives in Trinidad, Santa Barbara. Jose has worked in trade and commerce for his whole life. In the past, he owned a grocery store. He has been working selling chicken for three years, both at retail and wholesale prices. He also owns a shoe repair shop where he works repairing and making footwear such as tennis shoes, flip flops, heels, school shoes for girls and boys, and so on. The loan he requests is of 15.000 lempiras and he is going to use it to buy chicken and cold meat for selling and raw material for the manufacture of footwear such as leather, sole and glue, among others. His goal is to improve his two businesses and his relationship with his family.

loans.use: to buy chicken and cold meat, and raw materials such as sole, leather, glue and threads for the manufacture of footwear

loans.name: Arusha Group

texts.en:
Juliana, who is in her early 50's, is a widow with two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are still in school and the old one is married. She has been running a grocery store for three years now. She works from 9.00 a.m. to after midnight when she gets tenders on functions, such as weddings, send-offs, kitchen parties, etc. She has been in this business for three years now. She makes a fair monthly profit.

This will be Juliana's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to restock the missing items in the grocery store. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a wholesale shop selling drinks. 

Juliana will share this loan with her loan group, Arusha, which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in the grocery store.

loans.name: Chhorvy

texts.en:
Chhorvy is 46 years old and a widowed mother of four children, one of whom is in school, and remaining three have their own occupation already. To make a living, she sells grocery items as the sole business, which she has been engaged in for 28 years.

This is the second micro-loan for Chhorvy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking this education loan in order to pay for her son’s tuition fees. Her son wants to hold a bachelor's degree specializing in Information Technology. 

She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fees.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy, a mother in her mid 40s with seven children, is a rice grower on two and half hectares of farmland and a pineapple planter in the local area of Battambang province, where her residential area is. This business has been returning about 17,800 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Vy and her co-borrowers are in their first-cycled loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more pineapple seedling to expand her pineapple plantation. 

She hopes that this purchase will help her grow more pineapple and gain her a good yield.

loans.use: to buy more pineapple seedlings to expand her pineapple plantation.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза трудолюбивая и шустрая женщина. После замужества у них не было собственного дома. Она всегда мечтала иметь собственный дом, чтобы ее 4 детей не нуждались ни в чем. Ее супруг Алишер долго искал работу, но не нашел и уехал в Россию. Он там подрабатывает на стройке. Наргиза тоже старается зарабатывать деньги и накопить деньги на покупку дома. Она имеет собственный бизнес, то есть она занимается приготовлением салатов и их продажей. Она с удовольствием занимается своим делом, так как ей очень нравится ее работа. Она имеет горе. Ее дети заболели, но она не имеет денег для их лечения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения детей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nargiza is a smart, hardworking woman. After getting married, she and her family didn't have their own house. She always dreamed of having her own house so that her four children wouldn't be in need of anything. Her husband Alisher looked for work for a long time, but didn't find any and went to Russia. He works there in construction. Nargiza also tries to earn money and save up for a house. She has her own business preparing and selling salads. She performs her work with pleasure, as she really enjoys her job. But she has a problem. Her children have gotten sick, and she doesn't have the money for their treatment. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy medicine to treat her children. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her sick children

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 42-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife and their four children, who all attend school. He provides the only source of income for the family.

He has worked in agriculture for the past 23 years. He specializes in cultivating avocados and bananas and owns his own land where he completes his work. 

Today, with the aim of helping his crops grow faster, Bassam is asking to take out a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Bassam states that he will be utilizing the loan to implement irrigation canals. In the future, he seeks to start cultivating other fruits and to do so, he notes that a new Kiva loan will definitely assist him in realizing that goal.

loans.use: to implement irrigation canals.

loans.name: Thavin's Group

texts.en:
Thavin is married and a father of four children; one of them is still in school. He is residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Thavin manages 2 hectares of farmland for growing paddy rice and planting pineapple as the main source of family income. He has been involved in this current business for 10 years, and he is able to earn about 32,200 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Thavin's group is composed of four members, and he is a group leader. He has never taken a loan with Kiva's partner VisionFund before. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion to buy fertilizer for his crops. He hopes to run his business smoothly so that he can make a decent income to improve his living better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 39 years old, and she lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a real estate agent, a business that she has done for one year now, and she has seen a lot of progress. She is married and blessed with three children. 

She knew Milango through friends, and she decided to join so that she can save and be able to borrow and expand her operations. She wants to be operating more than 100 blocks of residential houses under her management in the next five years. 

She now seeks a loan to set up an office. The challenge that she faces is late payments of rent by the tenants. The income that she will raise will improve her standard of living, and she will also be able to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to set up an office.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Isata B. She is married and has four children who are 18, 16, 12 and 8 years old. In 2005, Isata B. established her school bags, traveling bags and ladies bags business. She began her business because she inherited it from her mother and since she was not fortunate enough to go to school, she decided to use the business as her own career.   

Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,800,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. Isata requires a loan in order to buy more bags. She was able to secure another sales outlet out of the profit she made from the previous loan, which is run by her cousin. Her plan of becoming an agent has not materialized, but she is still on it. As much was realized from her previous loan, she was able to make prompt payment of school fees for her children. Her monthly profit greatly increased and she was able to open a savings account with a commercial bank. She is still determined to become an agent for one importer in town.  

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags by the bale.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 59-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and their two children who attend school. Her husband works as a teacher at a local school and she cooperates financially with him to gather enough money to be able to pay their heavy living expenses. 

Mona has been the owner of a lingerie shop since 2010. She is a brave seller and knows very well how to deal with customers. Today, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to improve her business and purchase shelves so as to better display her products. Her intention at this stage is to augment her sales so as to increase her income. In the future, she is planning to add women's bags and accessories to her shop.

loans.use: to purchase shelves

loans.name: Rape

texts.en:
Rape is a Roma and a mother of seven children who is applying for a loan for the first time. She will use this one to stock up on used clothing and home hardware inventory items to resell. She has been running this activity for about 10 years and has purchased the used items from Greece. Since the economy now is not that great in the nearby country, unfortunately, she is planning to use other venues. 

“I liked dealing with Greeks, though, due to their generosity and also being loving and happy people. I had even learned a bit of their language and that made it easier for me and fun interactions. Let’s hope that these good people’s country gets out of the current situation soon and I continue my business relations like before,” said Rape.

loans.use: to stock up on used inventory items to resell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 51-year-old woman. She lives with her two children in Marneuli district. Elvira is currently unemployed. Her children go to school. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, but self-employment helps its inhabitants to make living. 

For this reason, Elvira decided to start a trading business with a loan, but local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Elvira's credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received this credit within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo called the Startup Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

With this loan of $650, Elvira will purchase stock of fruits and vegetables and then sell them. This will give her a chance to generate income and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to begin buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 25-year-old single lady who enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory, and she earns good amount of income to contribute to the family. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes and education.

In order to meet the growing demand of embroidery, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf foundation. In this way, she can manage to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors, which will help in generating more income. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history, and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors for her hand embroidery business.

loans.name: Las Vegas - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS VEGAS – 26, está  compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco mujeres y tres varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Sonia tiene 28 años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de vajilla,  ella vende sus productos en su tienda que se encuentra en la zona de Villa Victoria,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sonia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de vajilla al por mayor ya que época tiene mucha venta,  e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Sonia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar más mercadería para seguir surtiendo su tienda, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Sonia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio en la foto están nueve personas ya que una de las socias fue con su hermana.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Vegas-26 is made up of eight members, five women and three men. The president of the bank is Sonia, age 28. She sells a variety of dishes and cookware, and sells her products at her store located in the Villa Victoria area. This loan is her first loan cycle from the institution, and Sonia is going to use the loan to buy dishes wholesale, since this time of year she has a lot of sales, including orders. 

Her reason for requesting this loan is a lack of capital. Sonia faces challenges in her business like the daily competition. She will use the funds to buy more merchandise to continue stocking her store. Her hope for her business is to have merchandise in stock to offer a variety of products to her customers. 

Sonia is happy and appreciative of the institution for their support, which allows her to improve her business. In the photo there are nine people since one of the members was with her sister.

loans.use: to buy dishes wholesale.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 35-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has worked in the construction field since 2011, specializing in completing cement and concrete work. He has one part-timer who helps him out to achieve the tasks. 

Today, Mohamad is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a winch in order to transport his products easily. He states that the loan will certainly help him extend his work and increase his income by a large percentage. In the future, he plans to borrow more Kiva loans to develop his work further.

loans.use: to purchase a winch.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 26-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, brother and parents in a small village in the district of Dusheti. 

Agricultural activities are the only source of income for the family. In particular, George has cows. His wife and mother milk the cows every day and produce dairy products, which are sold at local markets at a good price. George decided to expand his herd of cattle and purchase additional cows. The Startup program, which is a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3000 to purchase the cows. 

As additional cows are purchased, the family will produce and sell more dairy products. Their income will increase and they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a single 24-year-old Lebanese man living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a bus driver for students since 2010. He transports students from their houses to school and vice versa. 

Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his bus and complete required legal papers. 

Mohamad is very positive and plans to buy a new bus within the coming year, and also to hire a part-timer to work on it when planning events or trips.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his bus and complete required legal papers.

loans.name: Noor Jahan

texts.en:
Noor Jahan is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She has been doing the business of crockery sales for twenty years. She offers various types of steel crockery, such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. Her husband also assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in local market. She makes sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. In this way, she would be able to purchase more variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. 

She is expecting boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Madaima Group

texts.en: Fanta is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fanta was born in Manjoro village, in eastern Sierra Leone 48 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has 2 children who are attending primary and secondary schools.  Fanta sells market food – palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. She has been doing this business for 10 years now. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Samra

texts.en: Samra is a 39-year-old married woman and a dedicated mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Samra’s husband, who has been running a donkey cart business for six years. He transfers things from one place to another and makes enough income through his business to meet his family's expenses. In order to purchase a bigger wooden cart, Samra requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. With a bigger cart, her husband would be able to carry more things at once, such as vegetables and fruits, and save time. Samra expects a boost in her husband’s income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger wooden cart.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
In 2005, Hawa established her school and ladies’ bags business. She began her business just after her father died, as there was no other means for her to get money to solve some of her problems. As a mature lady at that time, she decided to engage herself by assisting her friends in doing business until she got her own capital to start her own business. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,700,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. Hawa would like a loan in the amount of 6,000,000 Le. She requires a loan in order to buy assorted bags by the bale.
 
Her previous plan was to rent a shop. She also wants to accommodate more customers, though that was not achieved as a result of the exorbitant amount been asked for rent, but she still hopes to find a more reasonable amount to be paid for a shop rental. 

She is still pursuing a shop for rental as part of her plans, and also wants to locate another market area for her younger sister to sell. As a result of her being an agent, her profit margin increased and living conditions improved.

loans.use: to buy assorted bags by the bale.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the seventh time that the group has requested financing from ID-Ghana in order to improve their business. 

The group's representative, Victoria, is standing on the left in the photo. Victoria received very little schooling. She is 56 years old and married to a teacher named Richard. The couple has three children; two are grown up and one is in school. Victoria lives with her school-aged child and her husband. The couple takes care of the various needs of the household.

In order to provide for their needs, Victoria has been selling plantains, cassava, yams, cooking oil, iodate, tomatoes and canned fish in her region for the last twelve years. In order to bolster her business and to meet the needs of her growing customer base, Victoria is requesting a seventh loan of 2,600 GHS from ID-Ghana together with Ernestina. This credit will allow them to improve their businesses and to make more profit. Their previous loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy and sell plantains, cassava, yams, cooking oil, iodate, tomatoes, and canned fish to customers.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is a 36-year-old man. He lives with his brother and mother in a small village in the Zestaponi district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 cows and hens. His mother milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell. In addition, they have a vineyard and a 0.7 hectare plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Lasha was unable to study for a professional career. He works hard on family-owned agricultural land. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Lasha decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful, because of his poor living conditions. A start-up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 5,000 USD to sell cars. He will purchase and sell cars to generate income.

loans.use: to begin selling cars

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира добросовестная женщина. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Назира более 10 лет занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Ее муж строитель. Назира и ее муж не имеют высшее образование и поэтому они всегда мечтали, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование. В этом году их дочь окончила среднюю школу и поступила в университет. Ее дочь училась в школе отлично и в университете, тоже она учится успешно. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери. С такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 350 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора дочери. Она мечтает, чтобы ее дочь стала высококвалифицированным специалистом. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nazira is a conscientious 39-year-old who is married and has 5 children.  For more than 10 years, she has raised livestock and grown crops, while her husband is a builder by profession.  Neither she nor her husband have a university education, and have thus always hoped that their children would go to college and earn degrees in their stead.  

Nazira's daughter finished secondary school this year, and has enrolled in a university.  Her daughter received excellent grades in school, and is continuing to do well in her university studies.  Nazira is seeking a loan in the amount of $350 USD to pay for her daughter's tuition; she hopes her daughter will one day be a highly-qualified university graduate, and is urgently awaiting your help.

loans.use: pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Ngo Nyeheg

texts.fr: Leticia est une jeune femme de 29 ans mariée mère de famille . Elle est commerçante dans le domaine de la patisserie depuis 5 ans. Grâce à son accueil chaleureux et à la bonne qualité des gateaux proposés,et surtout aux prix pratiqués, elle a acquis une clientèle considérable et de plus en plus exigente.La petitesse de son chiffre d' affaires ne lui permet plus de satisfaire les doléances variées de la clientele. en effet,ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter un sac de farine et les ingrédients afin de diversifier et augmenter les quantités des gateaux. ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiare Elle économisera une partie de ce bénéfice pour l'investir dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Leticia is a young 29-year-old woman, married and a mother. She has been a merchant in the pastry business for the past five years.

Thanks to her warm welcome, the good quality of the cakes she offers, and especially their prices, she has acquired a considerable customer base, which becomes more and more demanding. Her low sales volume no longer allows her to satisfy their various requests.

And so this loan will enable her to purchase a sack of flour and other ingredients so she can diversify and increase the number of cakes. This will increase her sales and thus her profit margin.

She will save part of the profits to invest in her business, and the rest will help her to support her family.

loans.use: purchase flour and ingredients to make cakes

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been engaged in the business of milk sales for many years and is contributing a good amount of income to her household income. She has two buffaloes and two milk cows and she sells their milk to many of the neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing this together to support their family. Naseem is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR for purchasing one more buffalo to meet the increasing demand of milk. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Deeba

texts.en: Deeba is a 24-year-old lady. She has been sewing clothes for the last 5 years.  She is determined to support her family as her father is a government employee with a low income. She knows stitching techniques very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a stock of different colored thread along with packs of zippers, buttons, and lace. The loan will help her complete her customers' orders on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her revenue to cover personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different colored thread along with packs of zippers, buttons, and lace.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en: Yasmin is a married woman with 8 children. She is trying hard to fulfill her daily family needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been operating a glove-making business for the past 2 years. She has only 1 machine which has been purchased with the financial help of Kashf foundation. Her husband works in power looms. She is contentedly doing this for the sake of her family. Because of her work, she is respected in her home and is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Yasmin has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy one more sewing machine with some spools of threads. She is in her 2nd loan cycle, showing good credit history.

loans.use: to buy one more sewing machine with some spools of thread.

loans.name: Satta B.

texts.en: Satta lives and works in New-Kru-Town of Liberia, which is a poor area. Satta is married and her husband is a businessman. They both have 2 children aged 20 and 25. Only one of her children is currently attending school and lives at home. Satta was not fortunate enough to attend school, but she started a business selling short-bread seven years ago. With the loan proceeds, she will buy butter, flour, oil, wood, etc. for her business. She started this business with a little money from her husband, and learned the business from a vocational school. She enjoys how fast her short-bread always bakes. Her dream is to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy butter, flour, oil, wood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 24-year-old single woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for two years. She offers many cosmetic, hair styling, and facial services to her customers. She has become very famous on her street by providing the best services. Sajida is interested in buying a wider variety of cosmetic products for the parlor in order to meet her customers' increasing demands.  She contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her second loan, because she has low cash on hand. She needs a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She hopes to cater to more customers in the future. With the help of the loan, she will be able to increase her earnings to meet her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is a 26-year-old married woman. She gas been involved in the business of hand embroidery for a period of about 5 years. According to Sadia, she faced many problems during her early married life as her husband is a laborer and doesn’t earn enough to cover the expenses of the family alone. Sadia took the initiative to start her business with a small investment and now she has retained many regular customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. To complete the orders of her customers on time, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in different colors. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her business. She wishes to maximize her profits from this business to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: Clarisse est une jeune femme de 30 ans, mariée et mère de famille, .Elle gère un petit centre d'appels téléphonique(call box) dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 5 ans e .Elle s'approvisionne en crédit de communication auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques en moyenne 02 fois par semaine.Mais cependant,la demande de crédit et d'appel étant de plus en plus croissante,elle a du mal a satisfaire sa clientèle car son capital ne lui permet pas de s'approvisionner convenablement ce qui cause de constantes ruptures de stock et la perte progressive de sa clientèle.Elle sollicite dont ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner plus en crédit de communication, ce qui lui permettra de retenir et accroître sa clientèle et par conséquent ses bénéfices.Bénéfices qui seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité afin de l'agrandir le reste lui permettra d'aider son époux à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Clarisse is a young 30-year-old woman, married and a mother. She has been running a small telephone call center (call box) in one of the capital's districts for the past five years.

She resupplies her communications credit with telephone operators on average twice a week. However the demand for credit and calls is steadily increasing, and it is becoming difficult to satisfy her customers as her working capital does not allow her to maintain a proper supply. This causes constant supply shortages and the gradual loss of her clientele.

She is requesting this credit loan to acquire more communications credit, allowing her to retain and expand her customer base and therefore her profits. These profits will be partly reinvested so as to expand her business, and  the rest will serve to help her husband provide for their family.

loans.use: increase her communications credit

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 52-year-old, vigorous, married woman, and mother of six children. She has had a hand-embroidery business for the past fifteen years. Two of her daughters also assist her in making beautiful patterns. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Razia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the highest income earner in her household. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as different colored thread, sequins, and pearls. The loan will help her complete her customers' orders on time. She dreams of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as different colored thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Zulola

texts.ru: Зулоле 18 лет. Она успешно окончила среднюю школу. Ее родители так мечтали, чтобы их дочь получила высшее образование. Однако экономическое положение семьи не позволяет им, чтобы Зулола продолжала учебу в университете. Зулола не упала духом и поставила цель открыть свой швейный цех, так как она с детства научилась у матери шитью женской одежды. Она участвовала на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она умная девушка и верит, что она будет вести свой бизнес. Она запрашивает займ для покупки швейной машинки и тканей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zulola is 18 years old and has successfully finished secondary school.  Her parents hoped that she would continue her education and go to college; however, her family's economic situation does not allow it at this time.  Undaunted, she has set another goal for herself: to open her own sewing shop.  This line of work suits her, as she learned how to make women's clothing from her mother when she was a child.  She is a clever girl, and is confident that she has what it takes to manage her own business.  She has taken a course titled "Attain Success"; it was organized by an association for businesswomen, and Zulola received a certificate upon completing the course.  To help set up her business, she is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine and various kinds of fabric.  She is counting on your generosity, and looks forward to your assistance.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine and fabrics for setting up a new business

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom, aged 48, is a married woman and a mother of two children. She has an animal sales business. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to her family's income.  She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase his supply of milk and sugar

loans.name: Manzoora

texts.en: Manzoora is a 40-year-old married woman who has been in the milk selling business for the past 10 years. She has 1 buffalo and 2 cows to milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business allows her to lead a decent life. She has three children; one is in school. She is very motivated to provide a good life for them with quality education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet her family's daily living expenses. This is her 5th year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with its support. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to increase her milk production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.fr: marie est une femme de 50 ans  mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( tomates, piments,oignons...) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis des ananées. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai augmenter son stock de vivres en achetant en gros ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. Bénéfice qu'elle réinvestira en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is a 50-year-old woman and a mother. She is a merchant in one of the local markets, and for years has been retailing fresh produce (tomatoes, peppers, onions, ...), depending on the season.

She has a good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her customers that she has acquired over time given her experience in this field. However she finds herself constantly out of stock because she is forced to sell all her stock before she can resupply, due to her limited working capital.

She would like to increase her stock of produce by buying wholesale, which will not only increase her sales but also her profits.

The profits will be partly reinvested to expand her business and the rest will enable her to support her family's needs.

loans.use: increase her stock of tomato crates, hot peppers and onions

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr: Salamatou est une jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée , mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6 et 12 ans, tous vont déjà à l'école.elle est une ancienne commerçante qui gère depuis 11 ans un petit centre d'appel téléphonique( call box)et une petite échoppe dans un quartier de la capitale.Du fait de la petitesse des bénéfices générés par ses activités, de l'augmentation considérable de sa clientèle et de la constante rupture de stock , elle voudrait ce crédit afin de pouvoir régulièrement s'approvisionner en crédit de communication auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques ce qui augmentera considérablement son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui lui permettra de réinvestir dans son échoppe afin de l'agrandir et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salamatou is a young 35-year-old woman, married and mother of three children whose ages vary from 6 to 12 years. All the children attend school.

She is an experienced merchant who for the past 11 years has been managing a small phone call center (call box) and a small stall in one of the capital's neighborhoods.

Due to the limited income generated by these businesses, the considerable increase in her customer base and constantly being out of stock, she would like this loan so she can regularly stock up on communication credits with the telephone operators, which would considerably increase her profits.

These profits would allow her to reinvest to expand her stall and also meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Hasan is still a student in a local college where he studies engineering. Hasan would like to finish his studies with very high grades so he can find a good job and help his family in the future.

Hasan took a 625 USD loan from FATEN. This loan helped him buy a new laptop that he needs to use engineering programs to do his class projects and homework. Hasan appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu lives and works in New-Kru-Town, Liberia, which is one of the country's poorer areas. She is 28 years old and is married to a nurse. Fatu did not attend school. For the past 6 years now she has been selling rubber dishes such as bowls, pans, plates, spoons, etc. in the local market. She started this business with a little money that she earned from her husband. She says she enjoys selling to her customers and the money she generates from her business every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes such as bowls, pans, plates, and spoons, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes such as bowls, pans, plates, spoons, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 44-year-old married man with two sons and one daughter. He lives with his wife and children in a simple house in Khanyounis. For several years, Ismael has worked as an employee in the public sector for a very low wage. This wage is not enough to cover all of his family's needs, so he decided to open his own business renting wedding supplies like chairs and tables. Ismael dreams to improve his business.

Ismael took a 3,976 USD Murabah loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chairs and tables for wedding parties. This will increase his income and also improve the family's living conditions. Ismael appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and tables for wedding parties

loans.name: Leh We Pay Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Leh We Pay Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT and Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 400,000 Sierra Leonean leone (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Yei is the featured leader of this group. Yei is 50 years old, married, and has four children: two in primary school, one in secondary and one in college. Yei sells palm oil, onions, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. and has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy palm oil, onions, Maggi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, Maggi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Hanadah

texts.en:
Hanadah is a 41 year old married woman from Qalqilia city. She lives in a small house with her husband and six children: four sons and two daughters. For the past year, Hanadah has been working in her own sewing workshop where she sews different kinds of clothing. It is a profitable job and she earns a good income. Hanadah took a United States dollar (USD) loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop. This will increase her productivity and also her income. 
Hanadah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo in her workshop.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a 32-year-old Iraqi married client, who has a child and works hard to provide his family's income alone.
Mouhammad owns a blacksmith shop, where he specializes in making doors and windows from metal. He has a long experience in this field and has been practicing this business since 2010. Now Mouhammad has hired an employee and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
Mouhammad is requesting a loan of 2,400 United States dollars (USD). The aim of this loan is to buy a specific machine used for melting metals and to increase his inventories. Mouhammad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a specific machine used for melting metals and to increase his inventories

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en: Shafqat is a 41-year-old woman. She is an energetic single parent of five children and supports her family. She has been in the shoe making business for many years. During the initial year of her business, she had low capital because of problems receiving payments on time and was unable to expand her business activities. But with the support of Kashf Foundation she has gradually improved her business. She is now in her sixth year with Kashf Foundation. Shafqat requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy raw materials including thread, leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles. With this loan, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence can better support her family.

loans.use: to buy raw material  including thread, leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a 29-year-old widow and has two children for whom she provides care. She operates a food cafe in town. She has been in the food business for two years now, and the business has really grown. She has had to employ three workers to make sure that she serves her customers well. She found out about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy food such as flour, kalesa, and beans for the business. She hopes that the business will grow into a reputable restaurant in five years time. Extra income that she earns from her business will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy food stuff such as flour, kalesa, and beans

loans.name: Amber

texts.en: Amber is a 24-year-old married lady and a mother of two. Her husband is a sweeper so she decided to work for herself to support her family for a better future. Twelve years ago she started doing stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family.  However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Amber has borrowed 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy raw materials including cloth, different colored thread, lace, zippers, etc. so she may be able to generate a larger source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth, different colored thread, lace, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high crime rate, rare bathroom facilities,  filthy conditions,  and over population. However, it is interesting that in New Kru room rents are a bit cheaper, there are transportation options, the town contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and food is less expensive. 

Finda is 28 years old and married to a local businessman. They have two children aged 1 and 7. For the past five years now Finda has been selling rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc. She started this business with a small amount of money that she earned by selling charcoal for her friend. Finda says she enjoys selling to her customers and the money she generates from her business everyday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Iason

texts.en:
Iason is a 33-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and son in a small village in the Senaki district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and two calves. His wife milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources, and because he had to start working at a very young age, Iason was unable to study for a professional career.  As the family has only seasonal income, Iason decided to start selling clothes and sought credit among local financial institutions. However, his attempts were unsuccessful, because of his poor living conditions. The start-up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 900 USD. He will purchase clothes to sell with the loan.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for 15 years with the help of her husband. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to cover the expenses of her family members. She is a motivated mother of four and is responsible for providing them with good quality food, education, and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 40,000 PKR. The loan will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities to cater to more customers without delay. She hopes to increase her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una señora casada de 47 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijas la primera de 15 años y la segunda de 13 años ambas aún se encuentran estudiando en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por el  bienestar de su familia. Actualmente cuenta con un molino de nixtamal (sirve para moler maíz cosido),  el cual es utilizado para la elaboración de tortillas. Eligio esta actividad ya que cuando era pequeña su padre tenía un molino de nixtamal, es como de esta manera obto por esta labor que hasta el momento le  ha generado ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le han  ayudado a sufragar los gastos de su familia.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo  de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de otro molino de nixtamal,  con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y ganancias.
Su sueño es mejorar su economía familiar y sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 47-year-old married woman. She lives with her two daughters, the first aged 15 and the second aged 13, who are both still students in the Sololá Department. She is a hardworking woman who fights for the well-being of her family.

She currently has one nixtamal mill (used to mill cooked corn), which she uses to make tortillas. She chose this activity because when she was little, her father had a nixtamal mill. So that was how she chose this work, which up to now has made her an income and acceptable profits that have helped her to defray the expenses of her family.

She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 GTQ to buy another nixtamal mill, in order to increase her income and profits. Her dream is to improve her family's economic situation and to help her children do well in their studies so that in the future they will have better work opportunities.

loans.use: To buy a nixtamal mill (used to mill cooked corn)

loans.name: Saadiya

texts.en:
Saadiya is from Iraq. She is 57 years old, married, and has 3 children. Saadiya, her husband, and 2 of her children provide for the family's income together. Saadiya runs a small grocery store that is widely known in her neighborhood. She sells many products like snacks, drinks, detergents, and dairy products. She has been running this grocery store since 2010 and has much experience in this field. She now has hired an employee and is respected by the entire neighborhood.

Saadiya is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. This loan will be used to install an external ceiling for her grocery store and to buy more goods to sell. Saadiya is aiming to continue assisting her husband in providing their family with income so they may overcome their current financial issues.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling for her grocery store and to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Tulipanes Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento TULIPANES, está  compuesto por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Tarcila en la foto la que está sola inclinada tiene 33 años,  tiene 4 hijos de las edades de 12, 10 , 7 y 2 años, que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella  se dedica a la venta de comida  en su puesto fijo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Tarcila va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de insumos como abarrotes para elaborar sus paltillos, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital, la Sra. Tarcila enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que los  precios han subido y muchas veces los insumos  escasean y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos, para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Tarcila es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado.
texts.en:
The Tulipanes community bank is made up of ten members, eight of whom are women. Tarcila is president of the bank. In the photo, she is the woman kneeling.

Tarcila is 33 years old, and has four school-age children, ages 12, 10, 7 and 2. She works selling food from a permanent stall. This is Tarcila’s first loan sequence with the community bank. She says that her reason for requesting this loan is that she lacks the capital to invest in her business.

Tarcila says that her business faces some challenges because prices have gone up and there are often shortages of ingredients. She will use this loan to continue buying ingredients to make her food. Tarcila is a very hard-working person who says that she feels happy and thankful for the support the community bank gives her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Don Juan, tiene 64 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio de Yoro. Don Juan se ha dedicado a la agricultura y albañilería. Hace 12 años que el se dedica a la venta de verduras como repollo, papas, aguacate, frutas, cilantro y productos de abarrotería. Su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante en algunos puntos estratégicos de la comunidad. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 lempiras para comprar productos como verduras y abarrotes para la venta con el fin de obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan es salir a delante con su negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 64 years old, is married with five children and lives in the municipality of Yoro. He has worked in agriculture and construction. For the past 12 years he has been selling vegetables such as cabbage, potatoes, avocados, and cilantro, as well as grocery products. His business is mobile and moves between several strategic points in the community.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 HNL to buy products such as vegetables and groceries to sell, in order to obtain a better profit. His plan is to move forward with his business and family.

loans.use: to buy more product for his business, such as potatoes, avocados, cabbage, papaya, etc.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Fanta from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is divorced with 4 children between the ages of 13 years and 27 years old. Three of her children are attending school. She started her business because she needed to create a permanent source of income to support her home.  

Fanta runs a spare parts shop; she sells engine oil, rings and motor batteries. She has been running this business since 2007. She works at the business seven days a week for twelve hours per day.  Fanta says that the main challenge to her business is transporting her goods from the city to her business place.

Fanta has requested a loan in order to purchase engine oil, farm belts, and motor batteries for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to build a permanent business location. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase engine oil, farm belts, and motor batteries for resale

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three children, two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and healthcare. Her husband is employed in a furniture shop. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. Eight years ago, Rafia started her business sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is very familiar with stitching techniques and enjoys a large client list.  Rafia has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a new sewing machine and some spools of different colored thread so that she can meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some spools of different colored thread.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for the past four years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to cover the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill his family member's demands. 

Shumaila is a motivated mother of three children and is responsible for providing them with good quality food, education, and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani Rupees). The loan will be used to purchase large quantities of thread, rubber bladders, and leather covers to cater to more customers without delay. She hopes to increase her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and hopes to use part of her profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of thread, rubber bladders, and leather covers.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, tiene 43 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Lleva 6 años de dedicarse al comercio, vender cosméticos como ser cremas, maquillaje, lociones, y también ropa y zapatos. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y vende por pedidos también. Ha obtenido 4 prestamos con la institución con este actual que solicita el cual es por 25,000 Lempiras, que los utilizara para surtir de ropa y zapatos y poder tener mayor inventario que ofrecer a los clientes y obtener mas ganancias. Su plan es crecer como comerciante para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miriam is 43 years old and is in a common-law-marriage with her husband, with whom she has two children. They  live in a small town in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. She has worked in commerce for six years, and sells cosmetics such as creams, makeup, and lotions, as well as clothing and shoes. She does this out of her house and also sells by order. 

She has obtained four loans with the institution from which she now requests this current loan, for 25,000 HNL, which she will use to acquire clothing and shoes and to be able to have a larger inventory of products to offer her clients, and to make more profits.her plan is to grow her business in order to provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of three.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past ten years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons and zippers in various colors. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses in less time, and that will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons and zippers in various colors

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is 25 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for four years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Abida was not working, her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner as her husband was the sole bread winner of the family. Abida felt obligated to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is struggling to fill large orders. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR. It will allow her to buy a new stitching machine and some spools of different colored thread.  She is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine and some spools of different colored thread.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 24 years old and he lives in the Likoni area south of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married man blessed with two children, one of whom goes to school. He is a hawker and he has been in the business for more than three years now. He joined a group of other hawkers to join Milango so that they could save money and access credit to fund their businesses. He now seeks a loan to rent a shop so that he can wait on customers in one place. His business is challenging and sometimes he is not able to make sales. The extra income that he will raise will improve his standard of living and educate his children.

loans.use: to rent a shop

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 4 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community and to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.

Now she has requested a loan worth 20,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of sequins, pearls and stones in different colors. It will help her to meet the orders of her customers on time. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of sequins, pearls and stones in different colors

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael  es un hombre casado de 33 años de edad, padre de cuatro hijos de los cuales 1 hombre y 3 mujeres, quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá. 
El se dedica al cultivo agrícola, sembrando papa a  unos metros de su vivienda. Comenta que lleva 10 años en esta actividad que hasta el momento es rentable y productiva. 
Gracias a los consejos de su padre ahora tiene un trabajo seguro sin necesidad de ir a trabajar a otro lugar. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir al sustento familiar.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de semillas de papa y fertilizante químico para poder cultivarlo y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia en cuanto a educación, vestuario y alimentación.
texts.en:
Rafael is a married man, 33 years old, and the father of four children, one man and three women, who live in the Sololá Department.

He grows crops, planting potatoes on several meters of land where he lives. He tells us that he has been doing this for the past ten years and that so far it is profitable and productive.

Thanks to his father's advice, he now has a secure job and does not need to go elsewhere for work. Through the work he does, he makes an income and acceptable profits which help him to contribute to sustaining his family.

He is requesting a loan of 4,000 GTQ to buy potato seed and chemical fertilizer in order to be able to grow the seed and so increase his profits.

His dream is to make more profits in order to improve his family's quality of life in education, clothing, and food.

loans.use: to buy potato seed and chemical fertilizer

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been working in hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income and dreams for her children's bright and prosperous future. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet Hawa. She is a 38-year-old from Tombo in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 12 years. Two of her children are currently attending school.

In 2005, Hawa established a general merchandise business within a busy market area.  She began her business because she wanted to change her status of living. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to this business is that during the rainy season sales are very slow.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase milk, sugar, cigarettes, soap and drinks for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and improve her standard of living. In the future, Hawa plans to open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, cigarettes, soap and drinks for resale

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house.  Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in New Kru town. She is 48 years old, a widow with six children aged between 18 and 31; only two are in school and live at home. 

For the past nine years she has been selling roasted cassava and cold water along the side of the road. She started this business by selling rice and the few goods she could afford in the communities around her. She learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava and water by the sack for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and water by the sack for her business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Un joven de 30 años es Julio, que se esfuerza por salir adelante, dedicado a sus estudios, trabaja para una empresa privada como ejecutivo de ventas, cursa la carrera de Ing. en Sistemas los domingos, y los días de semanas asiste a clases de ingles, cuenta con el apoyo económico de un primo para sustentar sus gastos tanto universitarios como personales, ya que Julio recibe  un salario muy bajo. Solicita este apoyo de crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera el cual culminara muy pronto a finales de este año.
texts.en:
Julio is a young man, 30 years old, who makes an effort in order to get ahead. 

He studies, works for a private company as a sales executive, studies for his degree in Systems Engineering on Sundays, and takes English classes during the week. He has the financial support of a cousin to cover his personal and university expenses, as Julio receives only a very low salary. 

He requests this loan in order to pay the costs of officially obtaining his degree, which he will finish quite soon, at the end of this year.

loans.use: to pay the costs of obtaining his degree

loans.name: Mariama     B

texts.en:
Meet Mariama. She is a 48-year-old from Waterloo, Eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with six children. She has two additional dependents at home. 

In 2003, Mariama established a restaurant business within the Waterloo community. She began her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income to support her children; she works at the business from 10:00 am until 12:00 pm, six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is inflation in the price of goods.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, bags of rice and cooking seasoning. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Mariama plans to expand her restaurant to higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, bags of rice and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Marie from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with five children. She is very hardworking and has a desire to educate her children. 

Marie runs a pharmacy in Waterloo Community; she sells a variety of medical drugs such as malarial drugs, blood syrup and cholera drugs. She has been running this business for 11 years. She works at the business six days per week from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. Marie describes her major problem as poor electricity supply and transporting the drugs from Freetown to her store house.  

Marie has requested a loan in order to purchase more malarial drugs, blood syrup and cholera drugs. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and improve her level of living. In the future, she plans to open a hospital and employ the youth in that particular community. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more malarial drugs, blood syrup and cholera drugs.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu. She is a 49-year-old from Tombo, Waterloo western area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of nine months and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. For 15 years, Kadiatu has been running a general retail business within a busy market area.  She began her business because she wants to change her status of living; she works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to his business is that during rainy season sales are very slow.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase sandals, shoes and slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and repay her loan. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase sandals, shoes and slippers for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 44-year-old Isatu from Tombo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with seven children between the ages of five years and 25 years. One of her children is attending school. She started business because she needs to create a permanent source of income to support the home.  

Isatu runs a retail shop; she sells toothpaste, soap, drinks and fishing equipment. She has been running this business since 2000. She works in the business seven days a week, twelve hours per day.  Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is that transporting her goods from the city to her business place is very difficult.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to purchase food items including toothpaste, soap, drinks and fishing equipment for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to build a permanent business location. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items including toothpaste, soap, drinks and fishing equipment for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is 35 years old and lives with his family: his parents and his brother. Ahmad and his brother take the responsibility of providing the family income together.

Ahmad owns a workplace where he specializes in repairing motor generators. This business in highly demanded in his neighborhood since there is much use for motor generators. Ahmad has a long experience in this field. He established his own independent business in 2000. Now Ahmad has two hired employees and is being well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to expand his shop inside and to buy some spare parts used for his work. Ahmad believes that this loan will give him the chance to grow his business and will result in the improvement of his current financial conditions and will grant him the ability to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to expand his shop inside and to buy some spare parts used for his work.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. For the past two years, she has been running business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family at a point in time when her husband was the only bread-earner. 

With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She expects boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nenneh

texts.en:
Meet Nenneh. She is a 39-year-old from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of eight and 22 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

For the past 16 years, Nenneh has run an assorted drinks business within the Waterloo community.  She began this business because she got married early and she was maltreated, so she decided to empower herself with a business. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that during rainy season, sales are very slow.

Nenneh requires a loan in order to purchase more assorted drinks for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and repay her loan. In the future, Nenneh plans to expand and open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks for resale.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 41 years old, a vigorous, married woman and a mother of five children. She has had business of clothes sales for many years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well, while Tahira has become popular in her town for providing good quality clothes and she is the best-earning resource in her household. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy bundles of clothes in various colors and designs. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her seventh loan cycle with a good repayment history.  

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 37 years old and married with two children, aged two and nine. She runs a palm oil business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married and sells palm oil within her community. She says that at present, her business is doing well because out of the profit she was able to pay her children's school fees.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.
